description:
Apply modern Data Analysis and AI technologies and development tools to search, categorize, filter, and profile tens of thousands of operations that are extensively traced through a heavily multi-threaded multi-user server system. Goal is to associate and characterize these numerous flows then isolate areas of concern to visualize desired specifics within the noise. Multiple teams of embedded SW, applications SW, and signal processing engineers use this information to visualize and optimize the design.


Requirements:

  • Working towards Bachelors in Computer Science or Engineering or equivalent mix of education and experience.
  • AI and Data Analysis course work or studies.
  • Hands-on experience with development tools to include Python, C/C++, web/visualization/graphing platforms and languages.
  • Desire to learn complex heavily multi-threaded SW systems.
  • Ability to collaborate and communicate effectively in small team.

About Litepoint

LitePoint creates wireless test solutions and services for the world’s most innovative wireless device makers, helping them to ensure their products perform for today’s demanding consumers. A leading innovator in wireless testing, LitePoint products come out of the box ready to test the most widely used wireless chipsets in the world. LitePoint works with the leading makers of smartphones, tablets, PCs, wireless access points and chipsets. LitePoint is also at the forefront of testing the burgeoning world of connected devices…the Internet of Things. Headquartered in Silicon Valley, California and with offices around the world. LitePoint is a wholly owned subsidiary of Teradyne (NYSE: TER), a leading supplier of automation equipment for test and industrial applications. In 2019, the combined corporation had revenue of $2.3 billion and employs approximately 5,500 people worldwide.

Accelerate Your Career

Drive global technology


We’re a global market leader in providing software and digital marketing solutions to the automotive industry. We’re innovating the way that automotive dealerships drive their customers’ car-buying experience from the moment they run a search online all the way through to bringing their car back in for a service. Join us and be a part of the evolution.


We’re large enough to make a difference but small enough for your voice to be heard. This means that we are an organisation where every person matters. You can make an impact on the success of our business and that of our customers regardless of what career you decide to pursue.


We’re large enough to make a difference but small enough for your voice to be heard. This means that we are an organization where every person matters. You can make an impact on the success of our business and that of our customers regardless of what career you decide to pursue.


The Drive Flex team provides the tools, training, and services needed by application teams in the areas of operating system development, tools, testing, building, and deploying software.


As a Software Engineering intern on this team, you will be using industry standard tools such as: source control (Git), build management (Bamboo), deployment (Bamboo/Ansible), portfolio (Jira), and testing (Sonar, Saucelabs). You'll have opportunities to learn about DevOps technologies such as Terraform, AWS, Python, etc. The internship will provide hands-on technical experience as you work with other team members, architects and product owners in the early and continuous delivery of high-quality software products that delight our customers. Student must be a results oriented individual, who can use agile software development principles to achieve the desired business outcome.


Requirements:

  • Actively enrolled in a Bachelor’s or Master’s Computer Science/Computer Engineering degree program

  • Software skills (Java and/or React experience)

  • Experience with automated testing is a plus

  • A great attitude

  • A drive to learn and innovate

  • The ability to participate in a Summer internship program of 10 weeks


Why a career with CDK Global?


We demand diversity. Our people may be spread across countries, continents and cultures, but we’re united by a passion and enthusiasm to drive our business forward. This means no matter where you work you’ll feel like part of our global team. Diverse backgrounds, ideas and experiences are the only way to deliver world-class service to our customers. Our differences are our strengths


Your benefits. We will help you grow your career, not only through focused investment in learning and development but also by enabling you to explore the exciting opportunities our global market has to offer.


The perfect opportunity awaits. Start your career with CDK Global.

Company Description

Western Digital Technologies, Inc.

Job Description

We are seeking a highly motivated student intern to join a team of talented engineers in advanced HDD recording head technology development. As an intern student at Western Digital, you will be given the chance to work closely with scientists focusing on development of Heat-Assisted Magnetic Recording (HAMR) technology, specifically in recording head defect classification. You are expected to help develop a machine learning network to detect & classify defects within the recording heads using SEM images. The images need to be classified manually to be used as training data for the network, and also image processing techniques are needed to be used to further analyze the defects within heads. As an intern, you will gain experience in various defect analysis, machine learning techniques for classification problems, and data analysis. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: SEM image classification based on defect type, Characterize various defects using image processing techniques, Work toward building machine learning network for defect detection & classification. REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS: Current student, pursuing a pre- or post-graduate degree in Physics, Computer Science, Engineering or related field, Minimum of 3.5 GPA, Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, Strong technical skills in area of study, Interest in HDD, flash, semiconductor, components, nonvolatile memory industry, Proficiency in Python programming, Familiarity with image processing algorithms, Familiarity with machine learning. DESIRED SKILLS: Proficiency in image processing algorithms, Proficiency in Convolutional Neural Networks.

position: RAMP Flash Product Rotation MBA Intern
description:
Company Description

Western Digital Technologies, Inc.

Job Description

MBA summer @ the Product Rotation Program The position The summer internship of the Western Digital Product Rotation program is an intensive, exciting opportunity to work for ~12 weeks on a challenging project in our product organization during the summer. Roles in this program vary from Product Management, Product Marketing, Product Strategy, to other related roles. The internship is part of our broader Summer RAMP Program which combines all our internships across multiple programs. In it, you will take a deeper dive into professional life at Western Digital by getting exposure to different parts of the organization. Some program elements include: On the job training and mentorship with industry professionals Professional development trainings Executive exposure Networking events with other interns and Western Digital employees If you want to work at the absolute leading edge in technology innovation, then Western Digital is the place to work. Our products operate at the boundaries of what is scientifically achievable. At unimaginably small scale, using the most advanced technologies in the world. Almost any leading technology product in the world is powered by our products, whether it be mobile, IOT, internet, or wearable. We jointly innovate with each of these areas to bring you the future. Western Digital relies heavily on these MBA summer internship roles to fill our full time positions in the Product Rotation Program. The full-time rotation program offers the opportunity to solve complex problems in a variety of roles. The purpose of the Product Rotation Program is to create future leaders in our company by giving highly talented MBAs ample opportunity to drive work that matters, and the exposure and development that enables them to do this. Preferred qualifications Demonstrated ability and experience in effectively interacting with executives Strong quantitative and analytical skills Experience working through change and solving complex problems Team player, highly collaborative, while maintaining an agile mindset Flexible, self-motivated, and getting things done Experience Required - MBA degree and an undergraduate degree Preferred – undergrad in a technical field (e.g. Engineering, Computer Science, Math, Physics, or another hard science) Preferred - prior work experience in semiconductor industry Preferred – prior work experience with a top consulting or investment banking firm

position: Summer 2021 Intern - Software Development and Testing, Maxwell (Remote) - MASTERS/ PHD
description:
Ansys is the global leader in engineering simulation, helping the world's most innovative companies deliver radically better products to their customers. By offering the best and broadest portfolio of engineering simulation software, Ansys helps companies solve the most complex design challenges and engineer products limited only by imagination.

Ansys empowers the world's most innovative companies to design and deliver transformational products by offering the best and broadest engineering simulation software to solve the most complex design challenges and engineer products limited only by imagination. Thus, through our enriching internship program, we help develop the next-generation of engineers and technologists.

As a student intern, you will help develop our industry-leading simulation software while gaining real experience in your field of study. You will work on a variety of impactful projects to help maintain, advance, and accelerate Ansys products.

In this internship, you will support our EBU team. This is a 40-hour per week paid position starting May 2021 and concluding August 2021. This position will be remote.

RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Verify and validate new models
  • Develop new applications of existing models and/or identify software or model limitations.
  • Determine best practices when applying simulation software to solve challenging industrial problems.
  • Work alongside software developers during the design, implementation and verification process.
  • Develop unit and regression tests.
  • Analyze results and provide feedback to research and development team.


MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
  • Pursuing a MS or PhD in electrical engineering, mechanical engineering, computer science, computational electromagnetics, or related technical degree with a GPA of 3.0 or higher.
  • Currently enrolled in a full-time degree program and returning to university after the completion of the internship program.
  • Experience in applying Ansys Maxwell to solve low-frequency electromagnetic problems.


PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
  • Knowledge of electric machines
  • Scripting experience with Python


CULTURE AND VALUES
Culture and values are incredibly important to Ansys. They inform us of who we are, of how we act. Values aren't posters hanging on a wall or about trite or glib slogans. They aren't about rules and regulations. They can't just be handed down the organization. They are shared beliefs - guideposts that we all follow when we're facing a challenge or a decision. Our values tell us how we live our lives; how we approach our jobs. Our values are crucial for fostering a culture of winning for our company:
  • Customer focus
  • Results and Accountability
  • Innovation
  • Transparency and Integrity
  • Mastery
  • Inclusiveness
  • Sense of urgency
  • Collaboration and Teamwork


WORKING AT ANSYS
At Ansys, you will find yourself among the sharpest minds and most visionary of leaders, collectively aiming to change the world with innovative technology and remarkable solutions. With the prestigious reputation in servicing well-known, world-class companies, standards at Ansys are high, met by those willing to rise to the occasion and meet those challenges head-on. Because at Ansys, it's about the learning, the discovery and the collaboration. It's about the "what's next" as much as the "mission accomplished". It's about the melding of disciplined intellect with strategic direction and results that have, can and will impact real people in real ways, forged within a working environment built on respect, autonomy and ethics.

At Ansys, you will find yourself among those eager to drive the world towards the next best thing with hands planted firmly on the wheel.
Our team is passionate about pushing the limits of world-class simulation technology so our customers can turn their design concepts into successful, innovative products faster and at lower cost. As a measure of our success in attaining these goals, Ansys has been recognized as one of the world's most innovative companies by prestigious publications such as Bloomberg Businessweek and FORTUNE magazines.

Ansys is an S&P 500 company and a component of the NASDAQ-100.

For more information, please visit us at www.ansys.com

Ansys is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.

Ansys does not accept unsolicited referrals for vacancies, and any unsolicited referral will become the property of Ansys. Upon hire, no fee will be owed to the agency, person, or entity.

If you’re inspired by the possibilities of robotics to change lives and protect our warfighters – join us!


Robotic Research, LLC is currently seeking applications for an internship as an Engineering Intern - Fall - Systems Engineer. Our Engineers work on state-of-the-art autonomous vehicle systems. We offer a fast-paced environment where engineering comes first, and a breadth and depth of skills, knowledge, and interests are highly valued. You will have ample opportunities to get your hands dirty testing what you design in our specialized robotic engineering and test facility. As an intern you will have the opportunity to work hand-in-hand with our engineers to further your education and contribute to our projects!

Robotic Research has been developing cutting-edge software and hardware for autonomous ground, air, and naval robotic systems since 2002. We specialize in developing solutions for DoD, Automotive, Law Enforcement, and First Responder applications. We have a close-knit team devoted to delivering the best robotics technologies to meet and exceed our customers' needs. Our systems combine advanced control systems, autonomous mobility, perception, and behavior generation software with innovative and sophisticated mechanical and electrical hardware. We have a long history of successful program execution and have hardware and software on some of the highest visibility DoD ground robotics programs.

Building on our past success with deploying robotic systems for both military and commercial applications, we are currently expanding operations and looking for new team members who want to make meaningful contributions in the field of autonomous systems. If you think you would be a good fit for our team, we would love to hear from you.

Robotic Research, LLC is currently seeking applications for an internship as an Engineering Intern - Summer - Software Engineer. Our Engineers work on state-of-the-art autonomous vehicle systems. Robotic Research has been developing cutting-edge software and hardware for autonomous ground, air, and naval robotic systems since 2002. The TechStar Internship Program is a hands-on software engineering program that offers you the opportunity to jump start your career at a top-ranked technology company. Use cutting edge agile software development methodologies such as Kanban, Test Driven Development, Pair Programming, Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment

Qualifications

Pursuing a degree in Computer Science or related technical discipline

Ability to code in a functional or object-oriented programming language
Additional Qualifications

Strong candidates must also possess :

Strong problem-solving skills
A team player mentality
Passion for technology
Drive to learn and grow

Job ID: 312058

Directorate: Physical & Computational Sciences

Division: Advanced Comp, Math & Data

Group: Computational & Data Engineering

Job Description

The successful candidate will have the opportunity to support the creation, analysis, and access to scientific data created from a premier ground-based observations facility that advances atmospheric and climate research. The candidate will apply their software and data analysis techniques to support the evaluation of scientific models and algorithms to be implemented in a continuously produce data system to produce datasets for climate model development. They will contribute to the design/development of tools to simplify access to and utilization of the data, be expected to work both independently and within a team to support software design/development activities, including requirements analysis, code development, testing, documentation and deployment support. The candidate will also support client interaction through efforts including written communications, demonstrations, and presentations about technical activities.

The incumbent will report directly to the Data Services (DI) Group Manager. The incumbent will also work with the stakeholders and infrastructure and user community. Regular attendance will be expected at software project meetings, capability development meetings, and group meetings. The incumbent will also be expected to attend and be an active participant in tool design or usability/requirements gathering meetings with customers and users.

The candidate will be required to communicate clearly and effectively with colleagues and clients. The candidate is also expected to have strong technical writing skills and be able to present complex ideas to public audiences at project reviews and conferences.

Minimum Qualifications

Candidates must be matriculated/enrolled in a Master's program at an accredited college or university. Minimum GPA of 3.0 is required.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Bachelor's in computer science, Atmospheric Science, Physics, Engineering or Math

  • Candidates must be currently enrolled in a masters program at an accredited college

  • Expected to contribute professionally, applying basic theories, principles, methods, tools and technologies to well-defined assignments of limited scope.

  • The ability to work effectively independently and in project teams.

  • Creation and management of software documentation.

Preferred Education/Credential:

  • Scientific programming experience

  • Experience in Python, C, C++ and the UNIX/LINUX environment

  • Candidates who have experience reading and analyzing time-series data time-series instrument data, particularly experience with working with netCDF or HDF5 data.

  • Candidates with experience applying data science methods and practices

Job Category: Master's and PhD Level Internships

Group: Computational & Data Eng Group

Opening Date: 2021-04-30

Closing Date: 2021-05-05

Overview:


Software Engineering Intern - Bothell, WA


Internships are a great way for university students to learn about a technology or product they are passionate about while gaining practical work experience in a corporate environment. At Fujifilm Sonosite, we are committed to finding talented students who share our passion for medical device technology and this internship reflects that commitment! We have the opportunity, you have the talent! Read on to learn more about what we are looking for and if you think you’ve got what it takes to be successful in this role, apply today!


FUJIFILM, Sonosite, Inc . We are an innovative and high performance culture with tremendous opportunities. People who work here are given the unique opportunity to contribute to the advancement of healthcare throughout the world. Headquartered in Bothell, WA USA, Fujifilm Sonosite is represented by a global distribution network in over 100 countries. Since its inception, Fujifilm Sonosite’s lightweight, robust products have created and led the point-of-care ultrasound market. From sophisticated urban hospital emergency rooms to clinics in austere, remote villages, Fujifilm Sonosite systems are used by over 21 medical specialties and provide clinicians around the world with a cost-effective tool for improving patient safety and workflow efficiency. Fujifilm Sonosite holds a number of prestigious design awards and has in excess of 145 patents.

External US:
Job Summary:

The Software Engineering Intern will work as part of a focused, collaborative team of developers, designers, and clinical engineers who will help them understand how to contribute to the development of ultrasound technology. The SW Engineering intern will review and improve requirements for an ultrasound platform, prepare and execute tests for those requirements and have the opportunity to automate tests and fix straightforward defects.

Essential Job Functions:

  • Follow established standards for software design methodologies, coding, and documentation.
  • Review and improve software requirements
  • Develop and execute tests for those requirements
  • Prepare and review development artifacts
  • Automate software tests
  • Fix straightforward defects

Knowledge and Experience:

  • Pursuing a BS or MS degree in Computer Science or related discipline at an accredited institution
  • Experience with Android applications development under Android Studio IDE desired
  • Experience with Linux desired
  • Experience with configuration management tools (e.g, Git) desired
  • Programming experience in Java, C++, Python, and/or MATLAB desired
  • Experience with REST API desired

Skills and Abilities:

  • Strong problem solving skills
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills.
  • Ability to communicate effectively both within other groups in Engineering and throughout the company.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, small team environment with minimal supervision.
  • Excellent organizational and time management skills
  • Ability to lift 25 pounds, with or without accommodations.

ABOUT US: Scripps Research is ranked the most influential institution in the world for its impact on innovation. We expand basic knowledge in the biosciences, and use these fundamental advancements to develop profound innovations that improve wellbeing. Our educational and training programs mold talented and committed students and postdocs into leading edge scientists. Scientists in the institute’s five academic research departments work hand-in-hand with researchers of the Scripps Research Translational Institute and Calibr to merge foundational studies in biology, chemistry and computer science with translational science to produce pioneering drugs and advances in digital and precision medicine. Together, we cultivate new scientific leaders and expand the frontiers of knowledge to deliver medical breakthroughs to better human health around the globe. If you have a passion for making a difference, this could be your opportunity to join our transformative team.
POSITION TITLE: Intern-Research

POSITION SUMMARY:
The lab of Ilia Droujinine at the Scripps Research Institute is hiring a highly motivated Intern. We are a young lab aiming to develop novel methods to identify and characterize secreted factors that coordinate organ and organism functions in homeostasis and disease, with an emphasis on the mouse system (https://www.nature.com/articles/s41467-021-22599-x). To learn more please visit scripps.edu/droujinine. Ideal candidates will perform general laboratory maintenance, mammalian cell culture, mouse and/or Drosophila stock maintenance. The hired candidate may perform techniques including quantitative PCR genotyping, setting up matings/crosses, TMT mass spectrometry, metabolomics, western blot, pulldowns, DNA cloning, immunostaining, confocal microscopy, high throughput screens, bioinformatic data analysis.
ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:
Position is estimated to start June 1, 2021 and continues through the 2021-2022 school year.
Part-time: Up to 19 hours per week, up to 40 hours per week when school is not in session.
This position is not eligible for benefits.
This is a year-round position, not a summer intern or other short-term internship.
COMPENSATION: $14.00 hourly
REQUIREMENTS
  • Requires current enrollment in either a high school or college/university educational program. Undergraduate enrolled in a relevant scientific program, e.g., biological or life science, strongly preferred.
  • Interest in cutting edge biological research
  • Some laboratory experience in biology, chemical biology, biological engineering, or related discipline (relevant courses may be considered for laboratory experience)
  • High motivation and independence in reading scientific literature and performing experiments
  • Experience in basic biologic techniques, mammalian cell culture or mouse experience and experience with techniques outlined in the position summary preferred.
This position works in a laboratory or vivarium environment. Further details of the physical requirements of established essential functions for this position will be addressed/discussed during the interview process.
The above statements describe the level of work performed and expected in general terms. The statements are not intended to list all the responsibilities, duties and/or skills required of employees so classified, and the content herein is subject to change due to the business needs of Scripps Research, with or without notice. Furthermore, nothing in this job description shall be interpreted to be in conflict with or to eliminate or modify in any way the employment-at-will status of Scripps Research staff.
EEO Statement:

Scripps is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.
COVID-19 update:
The safety and well-being of our candidates, our people and their families continues to be a top priority. Until restrictions change, interviews will be conducted virtually. New hires will work remotely, unless specifically authorized for campus access.

PACCAR is a Fortune 500 company established in 1905. PACCAR Inc is recognized as a global leader in the commercial vehicle, financial, and customer service fields with internationally recognized brands such as Kenworth, Peterbilt, and DAF trucks. PACCAR is a global technology leader in the design, manufacture and customer support of high-quality light-, medium-, and heavy-duty trucks under the Kenworth, Peterbilt and DAF nameplates. PACCAR also designs and manufactures advanced diesel engines, provides financial services and information technology, and distributes truck parts related to its principal business.

Whether you want to design the transportation technology of tomorrow, support the staff functions of a dynamic, international leader, or build our excellent products and services — you can develop the career you desire with PACCAR. Get started!


Kenworth Truck Company's Electrical Engineering team is seeking a skilled and driven intern this summer! Interns will have the opportunity to contribute to the team with hands on projects and learn from the industry's leading experts over the course of 8-10 weeks.


Here's what you will do in this internship:

position: FAAS - San Francisco - Experiential Campus Program Intern - Summer 2021
description:
To submit your EY application, you must complete the below 4 steps:

  • Step 1: Apply using your school’s online recruiting system for only one of our positions
  • Step 2: Apply through our online system at www.ey.com/us/apply. Select the job description for which you are applying: Campus Full Time, Intern, or MBA Application
  • Step 3: Complete our Candidate Collect Form here (INSERT LINK)
  • Step 4: Complete a Game Based Assessment via HireVue. Assessment link will be emailed to you separately once you have completed steps 1-3.

What if your career could have a lasting impact on you, and on the world?

Here at EY, you’ll have the chance to build a truly exceptional experience. We’ll empower you with the latest technology, surround you with high-performing teams, and provide the global scale and diverse and inclusive culture you need to discover your full potential. Through our coaching and training programs, you’ll develop the skillsets you need to stay relevant today and in the future – all while building a network of colleagues, mentors, and leaders who will be on the journey with you at EY and beyond.

The exceptional EY experience. It's yours to build.

The opportunity: your next adventure awaits

Our Experiential Hiring Program is all about providing our people with the skills, information and knowledge to take on some of the biggest challenges in Financial Accounting and Advisory Services. Here, you’ll have the opportunity to spend time in a wide range of Financial Accounting Advisory Services (FAAS) service areas, covering everything from technical accounting, commodities, climate changes and sustainability services to digital analytics. After a few years developing into a broad-based FAAS professional, you will make an educated choice about which area of FAAS best aligns with your skills and interests, and with the support of industry-leading teams, there’s no better place to gain this experience.

The opportunity

The EY Financial Accounting Advisory Services (FAAS) practice assists finance leaders in addressing the strategic accounting and financial reporting challenges facing their business, whether in managing the ongoing finance function or reacting to transformational events, by providing practical market insight and access to proven resources.

How will I spend most of my time?

Below are some examples of the meaningful work you will do in the FAAS Experiential Program from the moment you join us, with support and guidance from mentors and more senior team members:

  • Engaging in complex compliance projects for our clients. This will be balanced with research, planning, and meetings with senior colleagues.
  • Working across all industries and interacting with our clients, you’ll develop your career by communicating and providing insight around data analytic solutions to solve our client’s accounting, finance, governance and regulatory concerns. You’ll be able to deliver exceptional client experience through the use of technology to help meet client short-term and long-term demands.
  • Assist clients in their efforts to identify, measure, and appropriately manage their business and reporting risks as they transition their organizations to respond to changing government environmental regulations and new trends in sustainability management and reporting
  • Collaborating with partners, senior managers and clients to influence strategy around commodity markets, balancing risk and client expectations
  • Consulting with clients on complex and technical accounting issues

To qualify for the role you must have

  • A predicted undergraduate degree in Accounting, Finance, Data Analytics, Computer Science, Economics or related major
  • A demonstrable plan for passing the CPA exam (if pursuing Accounting degree)
  • Excellent English language communication skills
  • Expertise in time management, and the ability to adapt to change under pressure
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, and the confidence to translate complex information into insightful, actionable recommendations
  • A highly collaborative approach to work, and the personal integrity to support not only your team’s interests, but colleagues across a global business
  • Flexibility and willingness to travel as well as work in excess of standard hours when necessary
  • A driver’s license valid in the U.S.
  • Integrity within a professional environment
  • Developing and utilizing a diverse network of colleagues across the business

What we look for

We are seeking self-driven problem-solvers and visionaries to work with other like-minded individuals to help bring added value to our clients and in turn help you develop your business acumen and domain experience.

We’re looking for people with a genuine passion for financial accounting and advisory services and are inspired to help the world’s leading multinational organizations meet complex obligations around the world. If you have the confidence to speak up and influence a team that affects big businesses worldwide, this role is for you.

What working at EY offers

We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, and a wide range of paid time off options. Under our flexible vacation policy, you’ll decide how much vacation time you need based on your own personal circumstances. You’ll also be granted time off for designated EY Paid Holidays, Winter/Summer breaks, Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being.

Plus, we offer:

  • Support and coaching from some of the most engaging colleagues in the profession
  • Opportunities to develop new skills and progress in your career
  • Gained flexibility through two-way communication and commitment with your engagement teams

About EY

As a global leader in assurance, tax, strategy and transaction services and consulting services, we hire and develop the most passionate people in their field to help build a better working world. This starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. So that whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.

If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.

Make your mark. Apply today

description:

Our future success depends on hiring world-class, early in career talent who are looking to power next-generation services and solutions. Oracle Analytics Cloud

(OAC) is a market leading business analytics and business intelligence platform that delivers a full range of analytic and reporting capabilities. Our Business Intelligence platform of products provides enterprise-class level performance, security, scalability and manageability apart from the very advanced and innovative features in core analytics. The BI platform is world-class federated database. It enables business applications to query data from multiple heterogeneous systems and perform advanced business analytics.

OAC’s application allows users to visualize, analyze, and explore data, as well as create consumable data products like interactive dashboards and reports. OAC enables companies to quickly and accurately gain a holistic view of their performance, as well as optimize their decision-making process. From advancing energy efficiency to reimagining online commerce, the work we do is not only transforming the world of business—it's helping advance governments, power nonprofits, and giving billions of people the tools they need to outpace change.

oracle.com

.

Java, Javascript, Groovy

High-impact projects:
You’ll get the opportunity to directly influence our cutting-edge products. Got a question or idea? Voice it. Your curiosity could help advance our next-generation cloud applications and help us find new ways to apply emerging technologies like AI, machine learning, and blockchain.

Grow from once-in-a-lifetime

learning opportunities

and exposure to the latest technologies. You’ll benefit from comprehensive on-boarding and job-specific training that will help you get the most out of your time with us. Leadership training will help you build your business acumen.

About this Job

Esurgi is looking for a motivated and self-driven Algorithm Design Engineer Intern. Algorithm Design Engineer Interns at Esurgi will be in charge of developing the pseudo-code for an early-detection biofeedback eye monitor for Alzheimer’s Disease. This internship is not paid, but college credits, OPT, or CPT are provided and highly encouraged.

Job Responsibilities:

  • Development of the pseudo-code for the eventual algorithm of an early-detection biofeedback sensor for Alzheimer’s Disease
  • Function as a technical content writer for the approach section of Esurgi’s Eye AD device
  • Acquire data to format the documentation of a biomedical device in collaboration with the engineering team

Minimum Requirements:

  • Experience in machine learning/deep learning and the ability to develop a program from scratch
  • Willingness to learn and experience working in a fast-paced startup
  • Understanding of neuroscience, specifically with knowledge of Alzheimer’s Disease
  • Strong mathematical and interpersonal skills
  • Aptness to use databases, including Firebase, Amazon Web Services (AWS), and more
  • Majoring in computer science, biomedical engineering, computer engineering, or any related field
  • Capability to write the documentation for an early-stage product
  • Aptness to communicate with executives and high-level management
  • Self-motivated and detail-oriented
  • Web and app development experience
  • Proficiency in multiple coding languages

Why ESURGI?

  • We have a strong internship program, where interns work directly with an outward-facing executive
  • You will be gaining a great mentorship with one of our executives with a background as a Faculty Medical Instructor and Research Associate in institutions such as UCLA.
  • Increase your presence in the healthcare community.

About ESURGI

ESURGI is a bio-health technology startup company. Our products include physical medicine, and rehabilitation and physical therapy, and medication reconciliation. ESURGI executives have built and developed successful technology companies. One of the companies in the Fortune Magazine as the World's Most Admired Companies and Forbes Fast Tech 25. Our executives have a medical research background in institutions, such as UCLA.

About our Internships: An archetypical internship at Esurgi is essentially a special project in the work setting. The interns will be assigned a mentor with an executive background. The intern and the mentor will develop an internship plan. This will be based on the intern educational background, career goals, and realistic (preferably interdisciplinary / team) projects within the Esurgi sphere. The plan includes objectives, success factors, and deliverables. The intern and mentor will meet regularly to review the progress and plan of the intern. Given these available data sources, what would be your approach to calculating that?

Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. Role:

Splunk is looking for highly motivated college students to join our team. As an intern, you will work on a real project (or a few) and have an opportunity to enjoy our dynamic, startup-like environment.

You will experience Splunking and what defines our culture while honing the skills which separate our development teams from others. Working to support internal and external customer needs, you will collaborate with multi-functional teams, receive mentorship, and gain insight into our values-driven process. Our goal is both to support your growth and development while empowering you for a successful start to your career.

Responsibilities:

As a Site Reliability Engineer Intern you will be responsible for …

Building innovative solutions for our next generation of our large-scale Cloud offering. You will get to work with a super smart bunch of folks who are working on robust, resilient, and auto-scaling platform solutions for hosting Splunk's enterprise software. The focus is always on automation, solving complex challenges that span across multiple groups within Splunk, ensuring smooth and expedient services to Splunk users. You will be working on the core compute platforms and hosting infrastructure within the Cloud.

  • You will design, develop, and test software systems
  • You'll actively contribute through participation in agile development of project timelines, implementation design specifications, system flow diagrams, documentation, testing, and ongoing support of systems
  • Your voice will have an impact through your recommended modifications to processes and procedures, and directly contribute to standard methodologies, architecture, and implementations
  • We will encourage you to live innovation by promoting and soliciting ideas within project teams

  • Possess knowledge of software engineering processes, agile framework, tools (e.g.: programming proficiency in a language, preferably Go, C++, Java, Python, etc), methods, test development, algorithms and data structure

  • Experience in scripting in/for a Linux or Unix environment.
  • You are passionate about learning new technical ecosystems and contributing to building and running distributed systems at scale in production
  • Interested in working with container deployment and orchestration technologies at scale with familiarity of the fundamentals to include service discovery, deployments, monitoring, scheduling, load balancing
  • Interested in identifying performance bottlenecks, identifying anomalous system behavior, and determining the root cause of incident
  • Eager to effectively work collaboratively across functions in a fast-paced environment
  • You are enthusiastic about making the many users of your product happier
  • You enjoy working well with others in a fast-paced environment
  • You enjoy working within an agile environment
  • Strong communication skills, verbal and written
  • You bring enthusiasm for solving interesting problems

Preferred skills:

  • Knowledge of Kubernetes and Docker
  • Experience with development and deployment in a hosted cloud environment, preferably AWS

Education:

Actively pursuing a Bachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mathematics or a related technical field, and strong record of academic achievement.

What We Offer You:

  • The opportunity to work with a set of extraordinarily talented and dedicated peers, all the way from engineering and QA to product management and customer support. Splunk flourishes with disruption and diversity
  • A constant stream of new things for you to learn and an opportunity for growth and mentorship. We believe in growing engineers through ownership and leadership opportunities. We also believe mentors help both sides of the equation.
  • A stable, collaborative and supportive work environment

We value diversity at our company. COMPANY DESCRIPTION


SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

About CyberArk:
CyberArk, the global leader in privileged access management, helps organizations transform their business through improved security and reduced risk. As a trusted partner for thousands of companies around the world, CyberArk consistently sets the bar – driving innovation and helping our customers stay one step ahead of attackers.


Job Description:

The Privilege Cloud Intern will assist in delivery, support and ongoing success of the CyberArk Privilege Cloud customers. Privilege Cloud is CyberArk's new “as a service” privileged access security solution. CyberArk is positioning CyberArk Privilege Cloud as a strategic offering that provides customers of all sizes with a cloud-native, SaaS solution to protect privileged access in their organization.



The Privilege Cloud Intern will assist the engineers and consultants in their day to day, accompanying the customer throughout all stages of the deployment life cycle. This includes planning, deploying, consulting, expanding and securing the customer's environment using the solution, while also being proactive and ensuring the success of the customer and future renewals with CyberArk's Privilege Cloud.


Responsibilities:

  • Assist Privilege Cloud customers with Service Requests and technical issues
  • Perform backend work in the SaaS environment, ensuring the redundancy and functionality of CyberArk's SaaS customers
  • Proactively engage with customers in order to ensure their success, directly contributing to renewals and customer expansion with CyberArk
  • Assist in deploying and configuring with the customer the On-Premises Components, and integrate the Service with the customer's environment
  • Assist in providing the customers support while the PAM program is being executed by the customers and consultants.
  • Processing and analyzing customer and product usage data in a SaaS environment for the benefit of both customers and CyberArk

Requirements:

  • University/College student entering Junior or Senior year..
  • Major studies focused in Computer Science, Information System Security, etc.
  • Capable of understanding the technical aspects of a complex system.
  • Strong technical troubleshooting skills and problem solving. Demonstrates the ability to think through situations outside the norm and develop appropriate solutions for isolating the root cause.
  • Must have excellent communication skills and a passion for providing world-class service.
  • Experience of directly supporting enterprise-level customers is a plus.
  • Ability and desire to learn products and technologies.
  • Must be able to work independently as well as with others, as part of a domestic and international team.
  • Excellent time management, decision making, prioritization and organization skills.
  • Thorough knowledge of Microsoft Windows operating system and server platforms with emphasis on Windows 2008/2012/2016 Server is preferred.
  • Knowledge of Salesforce is a plus.
  • Security+ certification is a plus.

COMPANY DESCRIPTION


SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.


About the SAP Internship Experience Program

The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, strategic, paid internship program that provides university students with opportunities to find purpose in their careers.


Three reasons to intern at SAP

  • Culture of collaboration: meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.

About the team

The Mobile Experience and Engineering (MXE), Chicago unit is looking for a highly motivated Developer Intern who has a strong interest in the full lifecycle of mobile application development. The MXE is responsible for the development and timely delivery of mobile enterprise applications. The MXE portfolio consists of a variety of mobile apps that allows users to work offline and online, supports iOS and Android, cloud-based deployment, and integrates with SAP ERP and SAP S/4HANA.


What you’ll do:

Position title: SAP Mobile Experience and Engineering iXp Intern – Software Developer

Location: Downers Grove, Chicago, Illinois – please note that roles will be remote until local guidelines ensure safe office reopenings

Expected start date to end date: June 7, 2021 or June 15, 2021 – August 7, 2021


In this role, you’ll:

Among other responsibilities, you should expect to do many of the following:

  • Assist in the development of mission-critical mobile applications.
  • Create unit-test and automate test scripts for feature development.
  • Investigate and resolve critical system issues for Enterprise level Fortune 500 companies.
  • Feel the satisfaction of delivering a solution to customers that makes their businesses run simpler and better.
  • Meet, work, and talk with colleagues and customers from all around the world!
  • Master SAP software that is being used by industries, governments, and multinational companies around the globe.


Be part of a small, tight-knit team of development professionals

  • Work collaboratively to provide solutions to customers.
  • Participate in daily scrums, sprint feature estimating, and sprint demos.
  • Work closely with Developers, QA, UX Designers, and Product Owners.
  • Learn new skills and technologies that will open paths to many new possible careers. The learning never ends – you are expected to continuously learn and up-skill during your time here.

We’re looking for someone who takes initiative, perseveres, and stay curious. You like to work on meaningful innovative projects and are energized by lifelong learning.

  • Candidates should have a current 3.0 or higher GPA.
  • Strong Java and C++ skills.
  • Excellent English communication skills (written and oral).
  • Excellent diagnostic and technical analysis skills.
  • A strong interest in mobile application development.

  • Swift, Objective-C, C++, JavaScript, Kotlin, or ABAP development skills.

Los Angeles’ premier mobile games studio, Jam City is seeking a Player Experience Intern to join its Player Insights team for the Summer 2021 Internship Program. A unique opportunity to join an award-winning gaming company, this is the perfect opportunity for a data-driven and ambitious individual eager to break into the mobile gaming space and gain valuable experience in the field of experience management, data analysis, and market research. Jam City is the creator of leading games like; Harry Potter: Hogwarts Mystery, Disney Frozen Adventures, Disney Emoji Blitz, and Cookie Jam. Our Summer 2021 Internship Program will be entirely remote.

Internship Program Qualifications:

  • Must be currently enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate university program in the U.S (upcoming Juniors or Seniors) and able to intern remotely through late August 2021
  • Applicants must be legally authorized to work in the US during the Summer 2021 session. Visa sponsorship is not available for our internship positions.
  • Be able to work on a part-time basis (up to 30 hours per week)

WHAT YOU WILL DO:

  • Partner with the Director of Player Experience and Consumer Insights team to inspire a player-first culture at Jam City and provide insights aimed to improve loyalty, retention, and growth.
  • Analyze experience management data from multiple sources including survey data, behavioral data, app store review data and social media sentiment. Reports will include analysis and recommendations on the entire player journey including discovery, game experience, and churn.
  • Create a player journey map for at least one game. This will include developing listening points in the journey (discovery, install, FTUE, usage, etc.) and creating a strategic roadmap for each point in the journey. The journey map will identify pain points, provide recommendations, and set measurable outcomes.
  • Create and modify SQL queries to analyze player analytics data used to support player journey mapping
  • Monitor and report on App Store sentiment and Social Media data for key competitive games
  • Play Jam City and competitive games as needed
  • Take initiative to stay current with industry trends and best practices in the mobile games industry and in the experience management industry

WHO YOU ARE:

  • Must be currently enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate college program in the U.S. (upcoming Juniors or Seniors)
  • Be able to work on a part-time basis (up to 30 hours per week)
  • Interest and some experience with quantitative analysis. Ideal student is currently in a Business Analytics, Data, or Computer Science program.
  • Experience with survey data analysis is highly desirable
  • Intermediate data analysis & SQL skills
  • Strong PowerPoint and presentation skills
  • Strong organizational skills & attention to detail
  • Passion for casual mobile games
  • Interest in psychology and human motivation

About Jam City’s Internship Program:

Jam City’s Summer 2021 Digital Internship Program will take place from June 14th - August 27, 2021 and will be entirely remote. Students can expect a paid, part-time (25-30 hours per week) internship working alongside Jam City’s business and studio development teams. Within internships, students gain valuable insights into our products, players, and industry. Our program allows students to work on impactful projects, collaborate with industry professionals, and develop problem-solving skills through real hands-on experiences. We’re looking for students that bring curiosity, creativity, and an interest in mobile games.

#LI-Remote

*
OUR COMMITMENT TO EQUITY, DIVERSITY, & INCLUSION*

We believe in creating games that unite people across the world and that showcase our commitment to providing an environment that is both inclusive and diverse for our players and employees. We strive to create a workforce that is reflective of our global player community as we know that we are stronger and better when we play together. position: SAP SuccessFactors iXp Intern - Onboarding Software Developer
description:
Requisition ID:282204
Work Area: Software-Design and Development
Expected Travel: 0 - 10%
Career Status: Student
Employment Type: Intern
Career Level: NA


COMPANY DESCRIPTION


SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.


About the SAP Internship Experience Program


The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, strategic, paid internship program that provides university students with opportunities to find purpose in their careers.

Three reasons to intern at SAP


  • Culture of collaboration    : meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
  • Project-driven experience: gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
  • Gain visibility: with SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.

About the team

The SuccessFactors Onboarding Engineering team is a global team responsible for the design, development, deployment and support of the SuccessFactors Onboarding solution. Being able to provide a personalized, interactive and engaging onboarding experience for new hires that set them up for success before day one is a key differentiator for the 2500+ customers that currently use SuccessFactors Onboarding. You will be part of the US Onboarding Engineering team which was recently established to ensure proximity to the critical North America market and be a source of innovation for the global team. We are a diverse and multi-cultural team based in Silicon Valley and we believe that our culture of openness and collaboration are key ingredients to our continued success.


What you’ll do:

Position title: SAP SuccessFactors iXp Intern – Onboarding Software Developer

Location: San Ramon, California (virtual)

Expected start date to end date: June 7th, 2021 – August 13th, 2021

In this role, you’ll:

  • As a software developer for the Onboarding Engineering team, you will be responsible for the design, development, testing and deployment of simple and complex features of the Onboarding solution.
  • Upcoming projects that you might work on include critical Compliance and Reimagined User Experience projects for the recently launched next-generation Onboarding 2.0 solution. You will also be expected to contribute to enhancements, fixes and ensuring high customer adoption for the new product.

Who you are:


We’re looking for someone who takes initiative, perseveres, and stay curious. You like to work on meaningful innovative projects and are energized by lifelong learning.


  • Minimum BS degree in computer science or related field
  • 2-5 years of experience in Java and related technologies is required.
  • Experience must involve the following: Web Application Development using Java; Database/SQL with Oracle or HANA; Advance J2EE programming; Web application using Spring, Struts & Hibernate; Programming Servlets and JSP; HTML and CSS3; Unit/Automation testing Junit & Selenium; and UI development using JavaScript.
  • Additional experience in the following areas would be preferred: Service-Oriented-Architecture and Microservices technologies such as Web Services, APIs, API testing; Product issues investigation using machine generated data and visualize customer impact using Splunk or Kibana; Working in a larger integrated agile framework using Continuous Delivery Pipeline technologies like GitHub/GitLab, Docker, Jenkins..
  • Experience in .NET is a plus.
  • Previous working experience or knowledge of Agile methodology
  • Top-notch analytical and problem-solving skills, with expertise in OOAD, algorithms, data structures, design patterns, RDBMS concepts
  • UI technologies such as JavaScript, HTML, CSS is a plus.
  • Willingness to “go the extra mile” to ensure that highest quality of experience for our customers

Follow @SAPiXp on Instagram and don’t miss anything about our experiences worldwide!


WHAT YOU GET FROM US

Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.

SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com).

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

position: Fall 2021 Intern - Software Development and Testing, Maxwell (Remote) - MS/ PhD - 7522
description:
Ansys is the global leader in engineering simulation, helping the world's most innovative companies deliver radically better products to their customers. By offering the best and broadest portfolio of engineering simulation software, Ansys helps companies solve the most complex design challenges and engineer products limited only by imagination.

Thus, through our enriching internship program, we help develop the next-generation of engineers and technologists.

As a student intern, you will help develop our industry-leading simulation software while gaining real experience in your field of study. You will work on a variety of impactful projects to help maintain, advance, and accelerate Ansys products.

In this internship, you will support our EBU team. This is a 40-hour per week paid position starting August 2021 and concluding December 2021.

RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Verify and validate new models
  • Develop new applications of existing models and/or identify software or model limitations.
  • Determine best practices when applying simulation software to solve challenging industrial problems.
  • Work alongside software developers during the design, implementation and verification process.
  • Develop unit and regression tests.
  • Analyze results and provide feedback to research and development team.


MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
  • Pursuing a MS or PhD in electrical engineering, mechanical engineering, computer science, computational electromagnetics, or related technical degree with a GPA of 3.0 or higher.
  • Currently enrolled in a full-time degree program and returning to university after the completion of the internship program.
  • Experience in applying Ansys Maxwell to solve low-frequency electromagnetic problems.


PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
  • Knowledge of electric machines
  • Scripting experience with Python


CULTURE AND VALUES
Culture and values are incredibly important to Ansys. They inform us of who we are, of how we act. Values aren't posters hanging on a wall or about trite or glib slogans. They aren't about rules and regulations. They can't just be handed down the organization. They are shared beliefs - guideposts that we all follow when we're facing a challenge or a decision. Our values tell us how we live our lives; how we approach our jobs. Our values are crucial for fostering a culture of winning for our company:
  • Customer focus
  • Results and Accountability
  • Innovation
  • Transparency and Integrity
  • Mastery
  • Inclusiveness
  • Sense of urgency
  • Collaboration and Teamwork


WORKING AT ANSYS
At Ansys, you will find yourself among the sharpest minds and most visionary of leaders, collectively aiming to change the world with innovative technology and remarkable solutions. With the prestigious reputation in servicing well-known, world-class companies, standards at Ansys are high, met by those willing to rise to the occasion and meet those challenges head-on. Because at Ansys, it's about the learning, the discovery and the collaboration. It's about the "what's next" as much as the "mission accomplished". It's about the melding of disciplined intellect with strategic direction and results that have, can and will impact real people in real ways, forged within a working environment built on respect, autonomy and ethics.

At Ansys, you will find yourself among those eager to drive the world towards the next best thing with hands planted firmly on the wheel.
Our team is passionate about pushing the limits of world-class simulation technology so our customers can turn their design concepts into successful, innovative products faster and at lower cost. As a measure of our success in attaining these goals, Ansys has been recognized as one of the world's most innovative companies by prestigious publications such as Bloomberg Businessweek and FORTUNE magazines.

Ansys is an S&P 500 company and a component of the NASDAQ-100.

For more information, please visit us at www.ansys.com

Ansys is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.

Ansys does not accept unsolicited referrals for vacancies, and any unsolicited referral will become the property of Ansys. Upon hire, no fee will be owed to the agency, person, or entity.

Nearest Major Market: Pittsburgh

The IT Global Operations and Technology team plays a key role in enabling JCIs business units, and the successful intern will gain experience in working in a fast paced, challenging environment. position: Summer 2021 Deep Learning Library Software Development Intern - MIOpen - (91163)
description:
What you do at AMD changes everything

At AMD, we push the boundaries of what is possible. We believe in changing the world for the better by driving innovation in high-performance computing, graphics, and visualization technologies – building blocks for gaming, immersive platforms, and the data center.

Developing great technology takes more than talent: it takes amazing people who understand collaboration, respect, and who will go the “extra mile” to achieve unthinkable results. It takes people who have the passion and desire to disrupt the status quo, push boundaries, deliver innovation, and change the world. If you have this type of passion, we invite you to take a look at the opportunities available to come join our team.

Deep Learning Library Software Development Intern - MIOpen


THE ROLE:
Join AMD deep learning software development team and broader open-source community to be part of high-performance machine learning and deep learning primitives. In this role, you will apply modern software development processes and design practices to implement features and optimize existing workflow and functionalities on existing and future GPU hardware, which contribute to the development and release of MIOpen, AMD's Machine Learning and Deep Learning Library for GPUs. MIOpen is a fast-growing project with broad adoption for several AMD product lines with unprecedented performance that make AMD the open and best platform for machine learning and deep learning applications.


THE PERSON:
You are expected to have strong programming skills and a product mindset with emphasis on best coding practices.

You are pursuing a BS, MS, PhD or equivalent in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Machine Leaning, Deep Learning, Applied Math, Engineering, or related field.

You are self-motivated, creative, and love challenges. You can also work independently, collaborate with team members to define goals and scope, and lead your own development effort.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Design and debug software runtime
  • Problem solving in a distributed environment
  • Strong C++ skills
  • Understanding of build systems such as make or CMake.
  • Basic knowledge about databases, computer networks and the Linux operating system
  • Basic understanding of docker orchestration

PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:

  • Knowledge of system integration issues
  • Knowledge of multithreaded and multi-process systems
  • Familiarity with Python
  • Familiarity with CI/CD systems
  • Understanding of distributed systems
  • Understanding of various test suites such as ctest or googletest
  • Knowledge of job scheduling systems such as SLURM
  • Familiarity with the GPU programming model
  • Knowledge of machine learning frameworks and various models
  • Experience with Scrum/Agile development methodologies.
  • Experience with and passion of any of the following is a plus – machine learning, parallel programming (HIP, CUDA, OpenCL), high-performance and massively parallel systems, GPU, and computer architecture

ACADEMIC CREDENTIALS:
Bachelor's, Master's, or PhD obtained or in progress in computer science, computer engineering, electrical engineering, or related fields

position: Fall 2021 Intern, Electronics Research and Development, Desktop (Remote) - MS
description:
Ansys is the global leader in engineering simulation, helping the world's most innovative companies deliver radically better products to their customers. By offering the best and broadest portfolio of engineering simulation software, Ansys helps companies solve the most complex design challenges and engineer products limited only by imagination.

Thus, through our enriching internship program, we help develop the next-generation of engineers and technologists. As an Electronics Software Development and Testing Intern, you will help develop our industry-leading simulation software while gaining real experience in your field of study. You will work on a variety of impactful projects to help maintain, advance, and accelerate ANSYS products. In this internship, you will support our Electronics Business Unit.

This is a 40-hour per week paid position starting August 2021 and concluding December 2021.

RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Develop and code small features using C++ and fix defects to enhance the product
  • Advance software robustness by testing and verifying defect fixes.
  • Conduct interactive and automated testing of user interfaces and simulation results.
  • Build tools that automate software development/testing infrastructure processes.
  • Learn and employ best software practices.


MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
  • Pursuing a MS in computer science, electrical engineering, mechanical engineering, aerospace engineering, numerical methods, circuit simulation, device modeling or related technical degree with a GPA of 3.0 or higher.
  • Currently enrolled in a full-time degree program and returning to university after the completion of the internship program.
  • Experience in with C/C++, Python or Java.


PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
  • Knowledge of graphics pipeline and graphics API such as OpenGL
  • Knowledge of scripting and shells like python, csh, bash.
  • Prior experience of software development and using ANSYS products or other engineering software is a plus.


CULTURE AND VALUES
Culture and values are incredibly important to Ansys. They inform us of who we are, of how we act. Values aren't posters hanging on a wall or about trite or glib slogans. They aren't about rules and regulations. They can't just be handed down the organization. They are shared beliefs - guideposts that we all follow when we're facing a challenge or a decision. Our values tell us how we live our lives; how we approach our jobs. Our values are crucial for fostering a culture of winning for our company:
  • Customer focus
  • Results and Accountability
  • Innovation
  • Transparency and Integrity
  • Mastery
  • Inclusiveness
  • Sense of urgency
  • Collaboration and Teamwork


WORKING AT ANSYS
At Ansys, you will find yourself among the sharpest minds and most visionary of leaders, collectively aiming to change the world with innovative technology and remarkable solutions. With the prestigious reputation in servicing well-known, world-class companies, standards at Ansys are high, met by those willing to rise to the occasion and meet those challenges head-on. Because at Ansys, it's about the learning, the discovery and the collaboration. It's about the "what's next" as much as the "mission accomplished". It's about the melding of disciplined intellect with strategic direction and results that have, can and will impact real people in real ways, forged within a working environment built on respect, autonomy and ethics.

At Ansys, you will find yourself among those eager to drive the world towards the next best thing with hands planted firmly on the wheel.
Our team is passionate about pushing the limits of world-class simulation technology so our customers can turn their design concepts into successful, innovative products faster and at lower cost. As a measure of our success in attaining these goals, Ansys has been recognized as one of the world's most innovative companies by prestigious publications such as Bloomberg Businessweek and FORTUNE magazines.

Ansys is an S&P 500 company and a component of the NASDAQ-100.

For more information, please visit us at www.ansys.com

Ansys is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.

Ansys does not accept unsolicited referrals for vacancies, and any unsolicited referral will become the property of Ansys. Upon hire, no fee will be owed to the agency, person, or entity.

Position Description:

At Lenovo, we are a community of innovative thinkers, risk-takers, and people who challenge the status quo. We are one of Interbrand’s 100 BEST global brands, BCG's 50 most innovative companies, and #202 in the Fortune 500 list. We are looking for passionate and driven students who are willing to learn and want to make an impact in a fast-paced global technology environment. Help us define our world of tomorrow.

About Our Team
We are one of the incubation teams inside Lenovo ISG (Infrastructure Solutions Group) and we are working on bringing innovative products and solutions to new and emerging markets, like Edge Computing. Edge Computing is a relatively new area with a multitude of challenges that are waiting to be solved. Besides developing purpose-built hardware for edge deployments, we are also creating software applications that enable seamless provisioning, deployment, and maintenance of the edge infrastructure.

What You Will Do
One of the challenges deploying edge computing is enhancing the provisioning and maintenance experience of edge deployments while minimizing TCO. Deployments can span across thousand of geographically dispersed sites where remote access can be challenging. With features like nZTP (near Zero Touch Provisioning ) and e2 ( end to end ) automated deployment, we are addressing the provisioning/deployment challenges. We are also working on simplifying the HW troubleshooting and maintenance process by leveraging AI/VR for enhanced troubleshooting and predictive maintenance.
Your primary objective this summer will be to evolve the software from a mockup to a full proof of concept that we can engage customers with. You will connect what you have learned in your computer science class with real-world experience…and yes, you will finally get to use those Python, Java, and Tensorflow programming skills!
This a strategic investment area for Lenovo with quite a bit of responsibility and visibility.
What an awesome opportunity! Of course, you will have a lot of support from our team as well as development and we will ensure that we will enable you with the right tools and mentoring you need to be successful.
As an intern, we also want to ensure you have an opportunity to network across the organization this summer as You might not know exactly what you want to do when you graduate, but maybe we can help you discover new passions and areas of opportunity.
If you are looking for more than just an internship, this is a place for you to grow, develop and learn.

Position Requirements:

You are pursuing a degree in Computer Science and your study are focus areas is AI/ML

Preferred Requirements:
You will be successful in this position if you are a coding whizz and have experience in C/, Python, Tensorflow, Unity Platform. You like to tackle new projects and not be afraid to take on challenging problems.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any federal, state, or local protected class.

Data Scientist Intern Summer 2021

At Oracle Utilities, we’re applying cutting-edge computer science to one of humanity’s greatest challenges: Energy. Our utility customers in the United States and abroad give us energy usage data for tens of millions of their customers, which we then analyze using state-of-the-art machine learning techniques.

The Data Science Team at UGBU builds many of our key insights and analytics, owning them from initial research all the way to scalable, multi-client models that can be deployed at scale for millions of customers around the world, to help consumers save energy and transform how utilities engage with their customers. Right now, we’re currently using deep learning techniques, smart meter data, and cutting-edge big data tools to learn how people use energy on a per-appliance basis, with more projects like this on our roadmap.

We are seeking highly motivated students with data science/statistics expertise to join our team for the summer. You will be involved in high profile projects; you will conduct data analysis and develop data science models to solve important business problems. You will have the opportunity to engage collaboratively with the teams throughout the organization and present your findings to a broad audience.

Currently pursuing an undergraduate degree or graduate degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics or related fields

Experience evaluating, fitting, and interpreting results of common data science models

Experience with Python

Self-motivated, independent, organized and proactive

Ability to think critically and work autonomously
