About Bevy: 100% Remote Organization

Bevy is an early stage Startup with a mission to help brands build, grow and scale their virtual and in-person communities. Founded in April 2017 by the core team behind Startup Grind, Bevy is an Enterprise-grade SaaS platform used by companies that include Adobe, Amazon, Asana, Atlassian, Ebay, Epic Games, IDEO, Intuit, MongoDB, Red Bull, Roblox, Salesforce, SAP, Slack and many more. In April 2019, Bevy acquired CMX which is the world's largest network of community professionals. CMX offers world-class training, events and research for the community industry. In May 2020, we raised a $15M series B investment to fuel our continued success and category expansion into virtual conferencing and events technology.

The Internship

At Bevy we've created an internship program that provides a carefully monitored and meaningful learning experience in which a student who has intentional professional goals will be able to actively reflect on what they are learning throughout their internship experience.

This paid internship is for you if you enjoy working cross functionally, blending customer insights and product execution, and building process. You will work on projects that impact the business.

You'll earn product management experience through things like backlog grooming, facilitating customer interviews, and launching new features. You'll collaborate with and gain exposure to other teams such as sales, marketing, design, and more.

At the end of your 10-week internship and depending on current project scope(s), Interns should expect to have worked on:

  • Defining a compelling vision and organising a team to deliver around it
  • Building processes for a team to enable fast, high quality execution
  • Writing clear, compelling PRDs
  • Participating in dogfooding, testing & defect burn down
  • Collecting and triaging customer feedback

All Interns will be able to:

  • Attend various lunch & learns sessions
  • Attend weekly team and company meetings
  • Network and work with a variety of teams at Bevy!
  • Duration: June 7th 2021- August 13th 2021
  • Schedule: Full-time (40 hours/week)

Product Intern Learning Objectives:

The primary goal of the Internship Program is to allow students to incorporate and emphasize the lessons learned in the classroom into a real-world experience set in a professional practice-oriented environment. The intern's work will be overseen by managers on Bevy's Product team. During this internship, interns will:

  • Be assigned challenging projects and tasks
  • Have broad exposure to the organization
  • Gain real-life and industry-related experience
  • Be provided with adequate, reliable, and regular mentorship from seasoned Product Professionals
  • Develop intentional learning objective goals that are structured into the experience and supervised by a professional with relevant and related background in the field of Product Management
  • Build both industry-related knowledge and soft skills

Product Intern Responsibilities:

  • Partner with design, product, and engineering to identify one key business need to generate user-focused insights
  • You collaborate closely with engineering and design to discover effective solutions, and then work together to deliver those solutions to market.
  • Organize internal and external documentation
  • Build processes for communication across field teams
  • Partner with product managers to solve hard problems – customer problems and business problems – in ways that our customers love, yet work for our business.

What we're looking for:

  • Working towards a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Business, Economics, or a related field
  • 0 to 1 years of experience in product related roles
  • Ability to work full-time for at least 10 consecutive weeks
  • You have a history of building things
  • You're comfortable finding a path forward in ambiguous situations
  • Strong organizational skills & attention to detail
  • Strong business acumen balanced with strong creative abilities

We welcome candidates from traditionally underrepresented groups to apply. We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. We strongly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better product for our users and the communities we serve.

Although we are a remote company, we try to minimize the time zone spread within our teams. Our daylight working hours are within the North and South America's timezone.

Our Team

We are a small but powerful team, dedicated to achieving our mission to bring more community to the world. Many of us have worked in community positions before and understand the struggles and peaks that come with the role. Our team communicates candidly, giving feedback early and often. We set ambitious goals, and do what it takes to achieve them, while making sure that we take care of our own personal health and mental wellbeing. We will want you to be ready to take on a lot of responsibility with guidance and mentorship along the way.

Raytheon Technologies Corporation (RTX) is an aerospace and defense company that provides advanced systems and services for commercial, military and government customers worldwide. It comprises four industry-leading businesses – Collins Aerospace Systems, Pratt & Whitney, Raytheon Intelligence & Space and Raytheon Missiles & Defense. Its 195,000 employees enable the company to operate at the edge of known science as they imagine and deliver solutions that push the boundaries in quantum physics, electric propulsion, directed energy, hypersonics, avionics and cybersecurity. The company, formed in 2020 through the combination of Raytheon Company and the United Technologies Corporation aerospace businesses, is headquartered in Waltham, Massachusetts.

Internship Summary

The Digital Leadership Development Program (DLDP) internship is our primary feeder for the full-time DLDP and provides valuable exposure to the broad range of RTX businesses and cross-section of digital technology skills, disciplines, and functions. The candidate will work closely with a Digital Technology team to deliver real results in the areas of business, technology, and process/project management throughout various operating companies. Interns will work at one of RTX’s dynamic global business units: Collins Aerospace Systems, Pratt & Whitney, Raytheon Intelligence & Space, Raytheon Missiles & Defense or RTX Corporate Headquarters.


The candidate will be responsible for delivering successful digital technology solutions for business critical projects in one of the following digital function areas:


  • Cybersecurity & Risk Management
  • Data Science & Analytics
  • Enterprise Business Systems
  • Infrastructure Services
  • Product Management
  • Software Development
  • User Experience Design

The successful candidate will be involved, and potentially work with current associates and alumni of the Digital Leadership Development Program (DLDP).

Internship locations will be based across the domestic United States.

Education / Qualifications

Must have a minimum of 30 credit hours completed.

Selection for the Digital Leadership Development Program internship will be based on the following minimum criteria:

  • Be pursuing a Bachelor’s degree with a specialty in Information Technology, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or other related discipline
  • Strong academic performance, minimum cumulative GPA of 3.2
  • Proactive and results-driven individual who thrives in a fast paced and dynamic environment
  • Excellent analytical and communication skills
  • Preferred strong technical skills in design, development, big data/analytics, infrastructure, IT/Cybersecurity, etc.
  • Flexibility and mobility to travel/live anywhere in the US and possibly abroad

As an independent group of companies, the BMW Group has a commitment to creativity and breakthrough ideas that goes well beyond the racetrack. We are pleased to offer a 6 Month Internship at BMW of North America, LLC.

Advanced Driver Assistance System (ADAS) Data Intern

You will support the US Automated Driving Team to perform function-regression and usage studies by analyzing large scale engineering and customer fleet data sets. The goal is to retrieve actionable insights for enhancing the BMW automated driving experience while minimizing testing and validation costs. You will help us to build the software tools and pipelines needed to maximize the leverage of these insights across different parts of our team.

The process of performing data analysis will include:
  • Analysis of customer fleet data to identify new issues, refine requirements or improve test planning
  • Use of data analytics tools and methods to identify and define US customer focused test cases and US market specific requirements
  • Use of large-scale data platforms such as e.g. Amazon Web Services (AWS) to monitor the implementation of these requirements into targeted functions and systems by use of data driven validation
  • Communication of US specific requirements and data insights to functional owners at the BMW AG headquarters in Munich, Germany.
  • Participation in validation test drives to align data based findings with real world vehicle use cases

By contributing to this process at any stage and in any technical field, you will experience a highly dynamic and interesting work environment.
What are you waiting for... jump into the driver's seat and apply for the Advanced Driver Assistance System Data Internship today!

  • Prior internship and/or relevant work experience
  • Availability to work full-time for 6 months
Preferences:
  • Field of study: Major in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology, Data Analytics and/or Engineering.
  • Requirements: Strong programming skills with a solid foundation in data structures and algorithms. Proficiency in Python and pydata stack (pandas, pyspark, scikit-learn). Proficiency in SQL/HIVE relational databases. Experience with statistical data analysis such as linear models and time series forecasting. Knowledge of automotive engineering and advanced driver assistance systems (ADAS).
  • Additional skills: Amazon-AWS experience.
  • Attributes: Motivated, conscientious, responsible. Able to work both independently and as part of a team. Strong analytical capabilities.
  • Previous work experience within BMW or the automotive industry in the field of data science / testing & validation.
  • Languages: English, German (fluent, oral and written)

Technology and Engineering - USA Oldsmar, Florida


OVERVIEW

Nielsen is the global leader for entertainment data & technology providing insights for broadcast and on-demand video, radio, and sports. Everything we do revolves around audience and content. We are launching a 10-week Software Engineer Internship Program. Our tech teams are hyper-focused on our ability to be a cutting edge tech organization. With a keen eye on state of the art technology, we look for “what’s next” when it comes to software, frameworks, tools, and cloud-computing services.


Joining our Software Engineer Internship Program means you will:

  • Begin with an induction covering our tech strategies, products and systems, as well as an overview of our technology community
  • Dive in head-first to gain hands-on experience creating innovative solutions that make a difference for our customers, clients and employees
  • Work with other Interns, experienced Software Engineers, and the global Nielsen technology community to grow your skills, share ideas, and innovate
  • Our Agile Technology Teams in the US are primarily in 4 major hubs. For your internship, you can be located near any of these metropolitan areas: New York Metro, NY; Chicago, IL; Emeryville, CA; Oldsmar, FL


WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?
If you are ready to put your passion for technology to work, you will find your place here. Successful candidates will have these competencies:

  • Open-minded and excited to learn and grow technology skills
  • Ridiculous attention to detail and pride in the work you do
  • Strong communication and relationship management skills
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment
  • Love all things data

  • Relevant technical project work around developing systems/applications with OO or functional methodologies
  • A well-rounded academic background with a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0

  • An interest in protecting privacy in the digital world [core to Nielsen Measurements' value] as well as an interest in hard computational problems

As the arbiter of truth, Nielsen Global Media fuels the media industry with unbiased, reliable data about what people watch and listen to. position: SAP Successfactors iXp Intern - Software Developer
description:
Requisition ID:282205
Work Area: Software-Design and Development
Expected Travel: 0 - 10%
Career Status: Student
Employment Type: Intern
Career Level: NA


COMPANY DESCRIPTION


SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

About the SAP Internship Experience Program


The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, strategic, paid internship program that provides university students with opportunities to find purpose in their careers.


Three reasons to intern at SAP

  • Culture of collaboration: meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
  • Project-driven experience: gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
  • Gain visibility: with SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.

About the team

Our Mission is to Provides the best Developer Environment with Infrastructure and Tools that empower and drive Engineering to deliver Customer Value with the Highest Productivity and Quality.

Position Overview:

As a developer in this team, you will design, implement, and operate the continuous integration and deployment infrastructure, pipeline, and tools, and will perform as a subject matter expert on CI/CD for the engineering organization.

The CI/CD DevOps participates in all phases of the development including design, development, maintenance of the CI/CD pipeline and infrastructure. The CI/CD developer will collaborate with engineering architects and developers of all levels in a global Engineering Organisation.

You must be a team player who is self-motivated, results-oriented, works independently, and have a “can-do” attitude.


What you’ll do:

Position title: SAP Successfactors iXp Intern – Software Developer

Location: San Ramon, CA (virtual)

Expected start date to end date: June 7th, 2021 - August 13th, 2021


In this role, you’ll:

  • Work closely with architects and senior engineers to design and implement the next-gen CD Ecosystem – including pipeline framework, test automation framework, build system, monitor and intelligent analysis.
  • Develop DevOps Tools/Services to automating all the process of software life-cycle to improve development efficiency without compromising product quality
  • Enhance Build, Test Automation, Release or deployment processes to prevent future build problems
  • Monitor and update technical projects status and communicate with management clearly and timely concerning progress, obstacles, team member capacity, etc.

Who you are:

We’re looking for someone who takes initiative, perseveres, and stay curious. You like to work on meaningful innovative projects and are energized by lifelong learning.


  • BS/MS in Computer Science.
  • 0-3 years of proven development and/or DevOps experience deploying and maintaining multi-tiered infrastructure and web applications.
  • Knowledge and understanding in automating Continuous Integration, Continuous Delivery, Continuous Deployment, and Agile practices for highly scalable system.
  • Knowledge with Docker, Kubernetes, Microservices, and container deployment and service orchestration.
  • Working knowledge with open source tools.
  • Knowledge with software development/delivery tools such as Jenkins, Git/GitHub, Artifactory, Gradle, Grafana.
  • Knowledge with OOP concepts and modern scripting and programming languages like Java, Groovy, Chef, GO, Python, etc.
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.

Follow @SAPiXp on Instagram and don’t miss anything about our experiences worldwide!

WHAT YOU GET FROM US

Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.

SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com).

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

position: NTD – Austin – Indirect Tax – GLICI/EDAS Intern – Summer 2021
description:
Our National Tax Department (NTD) serves high-profile, national and multinational clients, and is led by recognized tax professionals who represent some of our most senior tax talent. In today’s complex business landscape, our clients’ success requires a strong foundation grown in a sustainable way, so we work with our clients as an extension of their team. At EY, we believe that managing our clients’ tax obligations responsibly and proactively can make a critical difference, and here you’ll be at the heart of that mission. The underlying objective of the combined offerings is to help businesses navigate the digital age of tax transparency, alongside new trends in tax compliance and tax audit methods, as well as helping to solve the most pressing challenges that businesses face.


The opportunity

As part of Indirect Tax, you’ll provide a range of domestic and international tax planning services and tax-related advisory services within our State and Local Tax Technology Team. You’ll be a key member in a team whose combination of knowledge and experience assists clients in determining and implementing appropriate tax planning while identifying potential risk areas. You’ll develop a portfolio of highly sought-after technical, business and leadership skills, with support from highly knowledgeable colleagues. In addition, you’ll work with people from a broad range of industries so you’ll build a diverse professional network – all while contributing to and influencing decisions at the highest levels


What to expect

You’ll be an essential part of a team delivering technical, high quality work to clients. You’ll balance your time between multiple tasks, supporting the team in tax technical research, modeling and developing solutions, while building your foundational knowledge. As part of that, you’ll need to possess interpersonal skills, be able to absorb and observe, and be flexible in a changing environment.


Your key responsibilities

  • Researching complex tax issues and developing quality, practical tax approaches
  • Creating and contributing to hands-on analytics software development projects
  • Constantly monitoring and researching relevant performance improvement trends, tools and technologies
  • Identifying and implementing enhancements to ongoing service delivery capabilities
  • Protecting our reputation as an industry leader by ensuring our data analytics activities are always reliable and timely
  • Contributing to client satisfaction by promptly and effectively responding to client needs and concerns
  • Participating in client meetings and working within teams to deliver fully integrated services
  • Actively strengthening your tax knowledge through client assignments and current tax developments
  • Developing and delivering timely, high-quality services and work products

To qualify for the role you must have

  • Or be working toward, a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Data Science, Information Technology, or other related major
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office, including Excel, Word and PowerPoint
  • Superior project management, interpersonal, communication, teaming and organizational skills
  • Demonstrated analytical and problem-solving skills
  • An analytical approach to work, with a focus on using data to overcome complex business challenges
  • Flexibility and willingness to travel as well as work beyond standard hours when necessary
  • A driver’s license valid in the U.S.

Ideally, you’ll also have

  • A college minor in Decision Analysis or Business
  • A strong combined background in application development and working with business process data
  • Certifications in Microsoft technology

What we look for

We’re interested in intellectually curious people with a collaborative approach to problem solving. While you’ll need a strong interest in learning all about the technical side of the business, you won’t necessarily have extensive experience just yet. You’ll learn that here with us – what’s really important is your ability to think independently, act based on initiative and inspire others to further improve the way we work. If you’re a leader ready grow by handling a varied portfolio of technical projects, this role is for you.


What working at EY offers

If you join EY full-time after your internship, we offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, and a wide range of paid time off options. Under our flexible vacation policy, you’ll decide how much vacation time you need based on your own personal circumstances. You’ll also be granted time off for designated EY Paid Holidays, Winter/Summer breaks, Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being.

Plus, we offer:

  • Support and coaching from some of the most engaging colleagues in the profession
  • Opportunities to develop new skills and progress in your career
  • Gained flexibility through two-way communication and commitment with your engagement teams

About EY

As a global leader in assurance, tax, strategy and transaction services and consulting services, we hire and develop the most passionate people in their field to help build a better working world. This starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. So that whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.


If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.


Make your mark. Apply today

description:

COMPANY DESCRIPTION


SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.
SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.


About the SAP Internship Experience Program


The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, strategic, paid internship program that provides university students with opportunities to find purpose in their careers.

Three reasons to intern at SAP

  • Culture of collaboration: meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
  • Project-driven experience: gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
  • Gain visibility: with SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.

About the team

The SAP Procurement Engineering team has embarked on an audacious vision to make business commerce as easy as consumer commerce. Every day, we help our customer find opportunities to cut costs, reduce risk, and grow revenue through better collaboration with trading partners. We enable the collaboration through the Ariba Network – a cloud-based community where you will find buying, selling, and managing cash to be as easy as using Amazon, eBay, and PayPal. We also host other online communities where business commerce professionals network and share information and best practices, just like friends on Facebook.


What you’ll do:

Position Title: SAP Ariba iXp Intern - Full Stack Developer

Location: Palo Alto, California

Expected start date to end date: June 7 or 14,2021 – August 13 or 27, 2021


In this role, you’ll:

  • Have the unique opportunity to build and enhance our automation frameworks
  • Integrate Code Coverage tools to Automation frameworks
  • Have the unique opportunity to design, develop and deliver tools of our engineering team to significantly improve productivity and quality
  • Have the unique opportunity to design and develop simulators, validators and integrate them with automation frameworks enabling teams to reach automation goals
  • Design and implement a comprehensive framework to aggregate test results from various sources and generate a unified report


Who you are:

We’re looking for someone who takes initiative, perseveres, and stay curious. You like to work on meaningful innovative projects and are energized by lifelong learning.


  • Candidates to currently be enrolled in an undergraduate or master’s degree program which is applicable to the position (computer science or equivalent proven experience).
  • Strong programming skills in Java, JavaScript, SQL, CSS
  • Experience developing rich applications with HTML/CSS/JS
  • Experience in Automation Frameworks (e.g. Selenium, Katalon, Protractor etc)
  • Strong communication skills that include the ability to effectively articulate technical challenges and solutions.
  • Thrive in a fast-paced environment working with multiple teams across various geographies
  • Preferred experience: familiarity with Gradle, Microservices (Springboot), Redis, CI/CD tools using Jenkins, GitHub. Experience building cloud applications (e.g. Google Cloud Platform, AWS and Azure).

Follow @SAPiXp on Instagram and don’t miss anything about our experiences worldwide!

Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own.

CANON MEDICAL RESEARCH USA, INC.
is currently hiring for our ADVANCE Internship Program

Canon Medical Research USA, Inc. (CMRU) is proud to announce the launch of our 2021 ADVANCE internship program. Students will contribute at the forefront of innovation in medical imaging working alongside leading scientists and engineers as we develop and deliver the latest technology to our parent company Canon Medical Systems Corporation.

The ADVANCE Program is a structured program with goals and expectations designed to provide students with an opportunity to gain hands-on work experience by participating in significant work projects. Students will take on assignments throughout the term related to CMRU project needs depending on their skills and interests. The goal of these activities is to make important contributions to CMRU programs while at the same time significantly advancing the student’s professional and personal development. The program runs either 12 weeks during the summer term or 26 weeks during the summer and fall terms. This is a full-time, 37.5 hours a week, paid internship.

SUMMARY OF POSITION

CMRU is looking for a qualified intern to join our PET Image Reconstruction team and work alongside our Scientists and Software Engineers. The student will work on exciting projects using the latest machine learning technologies for medical imaging. Mentored by leading experts in the field, the student will gain hand-on experience of advanced medical imaging algorithms research and contribute to the development of next generation PET/CT products. This position offers a great opportunity to see how your research ideas can come to life and be used to solve real world problems.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Research, develop and prototype advanced machine learning algorithms to improve PET/CT imaging workflow and image quality.

QUALIFICATIONS

Education

The ideal candidate is a full-time student at an accredited college or university working towards a M.S. degree or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Medical Physics, Biomedical Engineering or a related field in STEM.

Experience & Key Competencies

  • Hand-on experience various deep learning frameworks, i.e. TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch or MatConvNet.
  • Good understanding in image reconstruction, registration or segmentation.
  • Hand-on coding experience and ability to quickly prototype.
  • A proven publication record in leading imaging conferences and journals.
  • Skills
    • Ability to identify problems and find solutions quickly
    • Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment
    • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
    • Organized and detail-orientated
    • Self-motivated to learn new things
    • Driven and hard-working
    • Ability to take direction and multi-task
    • Highly curious about how things work

Time Commitment

This is a full-time, temporary position that requires a commitment of 12 weeks (Term 1: Summer) or 26 weeks (Term 2: Summer and Fall) and 37.5 hours per week, Monday-Friday working remotely during regular business hours. The term can be adjusted somewhat to accommodate the academic calendar on an as needed basis.

Requirements

  • Students must be working towards a Master’s or Ph.D. degree.
  • Students must have taken several related courses in the field in which they will be assigned.
  • Students must be at least 18 years of age.
  • Students must be eligible to work in the U.S.

Copart is looking for interns to work on the development of application projects for our global expansion. You will work with Program Managers, Business Analysts, and Team Leads to understand requirements, and develop and modify existing applications built on Java, using modern, cutting-edge tools like Spring Boot, Rest services, Spring Cloud, Drools, Activity, RabbitMQ, Kafka, Spring JPA and Maven.

Assist senior engineers, and management, to achieve optimal application architecture and design, utilizing Java technologies
Assist in the development of efficient, secure websites, peer-review code, and document solutions within an agile-blended software environment
Communicate proactively with teammates, infrastructure, security, and quality assurance to continuously improve processes and engineering excellence.

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or similar, Accounting or Finance
1-3 years Java Experience

Preferred Experience:
Experience with web services and/or financial accounting
Experience with Spring Boot, Rest services, Java and Maven


For nearly four decades, Copart has led its industry in innovation and customer service, enabling it to grow profitably in markets across the globe. Our success is the direct result of the skills and efforts of our talented and diverse employees. Our mindset? It's never just a "job" when your coworkers are like family-it's like coming home.

What you do at AMD changes everything

At AMD, we push the boundaries of what is possible. We believe in changing the world for the better by driving innovation in high-performance computing, graphics, and visualization technologies – building blocks for gaming, immersive platforms, and the data center.

Developing great technology takes more than talent: it takes amazing people who understand collaboration, respect, and who will go the “extra mile” to achieve unthinkable results. It takes people who have the passion and desire to disrupt the status quo, push boundaries, deliver innovation, and change the world. If you have this type of passion, we invite you to take a look at the opportunities available to come join our team.

Software Engineering – Cloud Solutions - Intern
The Role

The AMD Cloud Solution Engineering Team in Server EPYC business unit and Data Center Group is seeking a co-op/Intern engineer to assist with research, application performance, tools and development, and debug centered on application workloads performance of AMD EPYC based clouds. We profile application workload performance in optimizing AMD EPYC-based cloud solutions for the leading cloud customers such as AWS, Azure and Google. We're committed to bringing together people, passion and customer focus to our business.

Your day-to-day
As an intern, you will work closely with your team members and take end-to-end ownership of project tasks assigned. You will be joining a team of talented engineers who work with you virtually on guiding you to complete your tasks. If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career experience with us!

Key Responsibilities

  • Help research and document AMD-based cloud solutions needs among various clouds – AWS, Azure, Google, and others
  • Research vertical industry solution blueprints and highlight cloud services used by the blue print.
  • Help setup, utilize, and maintain cloud VMs used for testing.
  • Assist in creating and planning solution programs with Cloud customers
  • Help write and/or review detailed technical documentation

Ideal Candidate

  • Pursuing a bachelors degree in computer science or related field
  • Have a willingness to get hands dirty building and testing applications.
  • Have experience with computer programming languages like Java.
  • Great communication skills and a love to learn new things
  • Excellent skills in preparing presentation documents using PowerPoint, excel etc.

LOCATION:

This role is based at our corporate headquarters in Santa Clara, CA.(preferred) or Austin, TX but with Covid19 restrictions, mostly virtual.

description:
Company Description

ServiceNow is making the world of work, work better for people. Our cloud‑based platform and solutions deliver digital workflows that create great experiences and unlock productivity for employees and the enterprise. We're growing fast, innovating faster, and making an impact on our customers' and employees' lives in significant and important ways. With over 6,900 customers, we serve approximately 80% of the Fortune 500, and we're on the 2020 list of FORTUNE World's Most Admired Companies.®

We're looking for people who are ready to roll up their sleeves and help us build on our incredible momentum, our diverse, engaged workforce, and our purpose to make the world of work, work better.

Learn more on Life at Now blog and hear from our employees about their experiences working at ServiceNow.

Job Description


Who is ServiceNow?

ServiceNow believes in the power of technology to create better ways to get work done, to make the world of work, work better for people.

We are excited and humbled to be named a “Great Place to Work,” a top U.S. employer by LinkedIn, and one of the best midsize employers by Forbes. We’re looking for people who are ready to roll up their sleeves and are passionate about creating products—and a company—that will change the way the world works.

Our Objective

This Internship will provide the opportunity for the best and brightest talent to collaborate with Sales and Solution leaders at ServiceNow and offer intensive on-the-job training and broad-based exposure to all aspects of company Strategic GTM methodologies. The participants in this Internship will receive accelerated professional development, world-class mentoring, and unique networking opportunity across the organization. A great candidate is a professional who is an effective influencer who can rapidly demonstrate impact and value to the organization. The candidate must be very comfortable in sales strategy, design thinking, problem-solving, and consensus-building.

What you get to do in this role


Thought Leadership and Insights

  • Work on critical strategic projects for Strategic GTM. Work cross-functionally to structure problems and develop hypotheses. Conduct analyses to turn available data into meaningful insights and solutions with actionable recommendations and measurable results.
  • Meaningful contribution to the creation of customer insights for the global and regional sales leadership team
  • Partner with our data analytics experts to pilot new data-driven initiatives to drive greater understanding of platform health, peer leading examples, and insight for the account team and customer executives

Customer Advisory

  • Participate and contribute toward customer discovery workshops to understand key business objectives, challenges of prospective and existing customers
  • Document and present insights and recommended solutions to meet customer business objectives
  • Creation of high-quality deliverables that communicate strategic alignment, present multi-year roadmaps, and document the full business case to justify action


Qualifications

Who YOU are:

  • Actively enrolled in an accredited university as a full-time student, pursuing a Master’s degree (Computer Science, Information Technology, Marketing, Business or similar, and graduate after December 2021)
  • Experience working on go-to-market or sales related strategic and operational topics
  • Financial analysis and modeling of ROI and TCO concepts to justify business cases
  • A belief that true outcomes are not accidental, they are crafted with relentless preparation, collaboration, and a deep focus on the details
  • Demonstrated ability to influence and consult decisions and strategy
  • Strong interpersonal skills and customer-centric attitude

description:
HiL (Hardware in the Loop) Truck on the Wall Designer Internship

Description

When you join Daimler, you become an agent of change within our global community of people working to create a cleaner, safer, and more efficient world for today and tomorrow. Through innovation at all levels, our teams ensure our world-changing brands continue to increase the quality of life and the business success of our customers, their customers, and the world around them. The Daimler Trucks North America (DTNA) brand portfolio is second to none, and includes Freightliner Trucks, Western Star Trucks, Detroit engines and components, Thomas Built Buses and Freightliner Custom Chassis.

We are the undisputed leader in the commercial vehicle market and the industry’s technology trendsetter. Empowered by purpose, DTNA employees drive a Technology Revolution through innovative products and a customer-centric culture. Our dedication to our customers and society does not end once our products hit the road. That’s because we believe that business success and social responsibility go hand in hand. We immerse ourselves in our customer’s experience, and support the environmental responsibilities of our sites to ensure our products are the reliable, sustainable and the desired tools of the future.

Job Overview
The HiL (Hardware in the Loop) team is looking for an intern candidate to work on the design and implementation of hardware test benches to aid in the overall validation of features and integration.


Responsibilities

The primary project includes design & build-up of the “truck on the wall”, which incorporates end devices and circuitry to support exterior lighting, door control modules, and other items for integration validation. The secondary project includes assisting the Diagnostics intern in the design and buildup of vehicle programming & validation test station (a.k.a. "Truck In A Box"), to be used by multiple teams within Mechatronics. Candidate will learn about vehicle electronic control units (ECUs), test bench design and build up, vehicle communication networks, diagnostic communication protocols & tools.

Further potential projects include: Support optimization of HiL Lab floor plan / space usage, add shelving for parts & tools; Support creation of “Truck on the Wall” documentation; Support creation of “truck in a box” documentation.

Program Webpage: http://internships.fnal.gov/fermilab-computational-science-internship/

Program Dates: May 24- August 13, 2021

We are:

Fermilab is America’s premier laboratory for particle physics and accelerator research, funded by the U.S. Department of Energy. We support discovery science experiments in Illinois and South Dakota and at locations around the world, including Canada, mountaintops in Arizona and Chile, and the South Pole.

The Computing Division seeks current graduate students majoring in computer science and related fields who are interested in working at a national science research laboratory. While providing the opportunity to gain experience understanding of Fermilab computing for High Energy Physics, the intern assists with laboratory R&D efforts to explore and enable the use of cutting-edge tools and technology for the benefit of the science community The selected candidate(s) will be assigned to one of the below projects.

Enhanced I/O systems for particle physics experiments

Current and next-generation neutrino and precision muon experiments at Fermilab will collect data at the multi-petabyte level and will require computing resources of a wide variety of types at sites distributed around the world. One of the major challenges to these experiments is data movement and management. With such a large array of possible resource types and storage elements it can be extremely difficult for end users to consistently make optimal choices when performing analysis, and what works on one set of resources may not work on another. The candidate will work with offline production and data management personnel to design and build enhanced I/O services for use by experiments within jobs. These services would perform a number of functions such as automatically choosing the optimal location from which to read inputs for a given job (or even steering jobs to known data locations) and choosing the most efficient location for initial job output storage. These services would interface with existing and planned data management and replication systems to allow for optimal data movement in and out of jobs with minimal user intervention.

Big Data analysis of data transfers in multi petabyte distributed storage system

Fermilab Scientific Computing Division (SCD) develops and operates a tiered data storage system that stores, manages and delivers to scientists hundreds of petabytes of scientific data. A tape backend and a distributed disk cache frontend forms the two tiers of the system. The disk cache frontend provides fast access to a subset of the data but is limited by the aggregate cache size while the tape backend provides large scale "cold data” storage with the bandwidth limited by the number of tape drives serving the system. The disk cache, tape drives and available network bandwidth represent a set of limited resources requiring clever data flow management to achieve maximum data delivery efficiency. Going forward the amount of data generated by physics experiments is expected to increase dramatically while resource levels are expected to grow at a much slower pace. Under these circumstances it is important to understand how the usage of the system develops over time in order to be able to find and eventually eliminate inefficiencies or pathological behavior. Each data transfer in the system is recorded resulting in data samples of about 10 GB/month. We are looking forward to performing Big Data analysis on these data with the goal of identifying patterns that could lead to improvements in the configuration of the system based on previous usage patterns. Ultimately we would like to develop ML-based tools that will aid in implementing ongoing self-correcting behavior in the storage system. We are looking for an intern position to help with this interesting research and development task. The candidate will work with the storage developers and operators to create a system to analyze the transfer data using Apache Spark and utilizing Python 3 and Jupyter Notebo.

Eligibility:

  • Enrollment in a U.S. college or university in Computer Science or related graduate program
  • 3.0 grade point average or above on a 4.0 scale
  • Eligible to work in the United States

Application Requirements:

  • Online application
  • Proficiency questionnaire
  • Unofficial transcript

Internship Deliverables:

  • Oral presentation
  • Poster presentation

Internship Details:

  • Salary: $825 - $875 weekly depending on the academic year
  • Remote: This internship will be 100% remote. Selected candidate must live in the United States.


Fermilab is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Underrepresented Minorities/Women/Disabled/Veterans are encouraged to apply.

At Moore Colson, we are a business based on ethics and integrity. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

Job Description:


About BDP International:

BDP International is a privately held, family-owned non-asset based global logistics provider with annual sales exceeding $2.1 billion USD. Founded in 1966 by Richard Bolte Sr. and based in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, BDP has grown to be one of the largest logistics providers in the world. BDP employs more than 4,100 people worldwide, and operates freight logistics centers in 270 cities across the world through a global network of wholly owned offices, joint ventures and affiliates in 135 countries.

The company serves more than 4,000 customers worldwide. Clients include Bayer, Dow, DuPont, Heineken USA, Honeywell, Johnson & Johnson, Revlon, Trek Bicycle, Wacker, and others.

Your Mission

We are looking to explore how AI/ML techniques can enhance our ability to solve various pre-defined business issues. Opportunities exist in the categories of prediction (leading to automation), exception identification and handling and revenue enhancement. You will work within our global IT team, analyzing defined opportunities and helping to guide us to productive data endeavors. As a vital team member you will explore, benchmark and improve approaches to the provided opportunities. You will have the opportunity to contribute to the development and implementation of novel ideas and methods in the pursuit of better business outcomes.

Your Tasks

  • Determine the opportunities provided with the most likely positive outcomes
  • Conduct research in machine learning and optimization for the opportunities provided
  • Propose the best approaches to develop the optimal outcomes to each opportunity
  • Collaborate with the development teams to assist them in moving your research to production models



Job Requirements:
  • Demonstrated deep understanding of machine learning
  • Personal enjoyment in applying ML theory to solve real business problems
  • Have or are in the process of completing a degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics or other relevant field
  • Enjoy finding solutions to new problems
  • Ability to work productively in independent research and analysis

Work hours and location will be flexible.


Please note: There is no relocation or immigration assistance associated with this opening.

Compensation based on experience. We offer a very competitive salary, matching 401(k) and casual dress environment.


Please visit our website: www.bdpinternational.com

description:
Requisition ID: 285292
Work Area: Software-Development Operations
Expected Travel: 0 - 10%

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.
SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.


About the SAP Internship Experience Program

The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, strategic, paid internship program that provides university students with opportunities to find purpose in their careers.


Three reasons to intern at SAP

  • Culture of collaboration: meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
  • Project-driven experience: gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
  • Gain visibility: with SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.


About the team

The SAP Innovation Center at Newport Beach, California is looking for a highly motivated data science intern to join the team for an internship. This is a remote position for pacific time zone. In case the situation permits, office visits in Newport Beach, CA will be possible. In this role, you will be able to work on concrete data science projects and experiments involving machine learning, deep learning, and natural language processing.


The SAP Innovation Center is a global and diverse team with locations around the world. You will get the opportunity to build and contribute to solutions that future-proof SAP.


https://icn.sap.com/


What you’ll do:

Position title: SAP Innovation Center iXp Intern – Data Scientist

Location: Newport Beach, CA – please note that roles will be remote until local guidelines ensure safe office reopenings

Expected start date: June 7, 2021 (flexible). Internship will be for 6 months duration


In this role, you’ll:

  • Work though the end-to-end data science lifecycle including problem formulation, data exporation, data cleaning, model building, cross validation, and hypothesis testing.
  • Work with state-of-the-art AI models, particularly in natural language processing, and leverage them to solve concrete data science problems.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to ensure the solution you design solves the problem.
  • Gain first hand experience on dealing with real world data.
  • Potentially advance the state-of-the-art and, if successful, produce an academic paper to be submitted to a conference (depends on project).


Who you are:

We’re looking for someone who takes initiative, perseveres, and stay curious. You like to work on meaningful innovative projects and are energized by lifelong learning.

  • Strong programming skills in Python and familiarity with ML libraries such as Numpy, Pandas, Sci-kit Learn, Tensorflow, Pytorch, etc.
  • Understanding of machine learning fundamentals such as supervised learning, unsupervised learning, classification, and regression.
  • Mathematical foundations in statistics and probability, optimization algorithms, and linear algebra.
  • Currently enrolled in a master’s degree program which is applicable to the position (computer science, data science, or equivalent proven experience)
  • Strong communication skills that include the ability to effectively articulate technical challenges and solutions.
  • Preferred: some exposure to deep learning and/or natural language processing.


Follow @SAPiXp on Instagram and don’t miss anything about our experiences worldwide!


WHAT YOU GET FROM US
Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own.
A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.

SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team. (Americas:Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com). Requests for reasonable accommodation will be considered on a case-by-case basis. Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability:
Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status or disability.

EigenPatterns is looking for a data scientist intern to be a part of a small team that is building a real time platform for pipeline monitoring, anomaly detection and image classification in large scale systems. The platform will utilize real time data, advanced machine learning and agent interfaces to deliver scalable and real time decisioning. As a key member of the team you will be responsible for building and testing anomaly detection and pattern classification models on time series and image data, including deep learning methods to classify images in a variety of contexts. The data scientist will also be required to work on the development of lean implementation of algorithms, integration with real time services and deployment on hardware.

We offer a competitive salary.

Required Qualifications

  • Four year undergraduate degree in computer science, mathematics or engineering
  • Masters degree in computer science, mathematics, operations research or statistics
  • Prior demonstrated experience with classification of time series and image data using deep networks is a strong plus
  • Prior experience in developing models and analytics using Python, a strong plus
  • Demonstrated understanding of statistical modeling and optimization techniques
  • Demonstrated ability to develop production quality code
  • Prior experience with large scale data analytics and algorithms that can be executed in real time, is a strong plus

Responsibilities
You will be responsible for building and deploying a scalable and real time detection engine. Key responsibilities include:

  • Working with the product team and engineers to understand the business specifications
  • Create Python/Spark libraries to accurately detect anomalies and patterns in time series data
  • Develop real time algorithms for a variety of use cases relating to feature identification and classification of images
  • Working with a skilled and experienced team to develop and test different modeling and statistical pattern recognition approaches, and benchmark performance
  • Create simulated datasets and set up environments to simulate processing of real time data and measure performance and accuracy
  • Work with the engineering team to deploy libraries and test execution in hardware and as part of real time software services
  • Create basic reporting and visualization to output results of algorithms
  • Create and maintain code versions on GitHub
  • Work with customers to deploy and optimize services.

About EigenPatterns Inc.
We are an early stage startup based in the San Francisco Bay area. EigenPatterns develops collaborative anomaly detection and pattern recognition systems that blend machine learning and human insight, to deliver powerful real-time monitoring capabilities. We are a recipient of a prestigious National Science Foundation grant and are making energy safer for millions of people.

EigenPatterns is led by a skilled team with world-class expertise and decades of experience in statistical algorithm development, technology and software engineering, and an extensive publication record in leading journals. Built and deployed large-scale data and analytical services at companies like American Express and eBay/PayPal.

Schedule:

Work Location:

position: Enterprise Dashboards Product Management Intern - Remote Fall 2021
description:
Join us as we pursue our vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey!


Dashboards are the face of Splunk and are heavily used by our customers to turn data into actionable insights. As an Enterprise Dashboards Product Management Intern, you will meet with customers to solicit their feedback and requirements, partner with UX and engineering to define and ship features, and influence the roadmap.


RESPONSIBILITIES:

As a Product Manager Intern you will be responsible for …


  • Collecting customer feedback and conduct market research to define feature requirements
  • Collaborating closely with UX to design and test the feature with users
  • Partnering with engineering to drive feature delivery and triage customer bugs
  • Providing enablement on the new feature to product marketing, field partners, and technical and support teams


REQUIREMENTS:


  • Experience building meaningful software applications: in a class, as a personal hobby, as a job, or as part of an open source project
  • You bring enthusiasm for solving interesting problems

  • Product sense to source feedback, define product requirements, drive consensus and create an executable plan to solve problems

  • Ability to define user stories in collaboration with Engineering team
  • Strong project execution skills, attention to detail and quality
  • Ability to deal with ambiguity – given an open-ended task, you can seek out and read documentation and can deliver great work with minimal direction


EDUCATION:

Actively pursuing a Bachelor’s in Computer Science, or a related technical field, and a strong record of academic achievement.


WHAT WE OFFER YOU:

  • The opportunity to work with a set of extraordinarily talented and dedicated peers, all the way from engineering and QA to product management and customer support. Splunk flourishes with disruption and diversity.

  • A constant stream of new things for you to learn and an opportunity for growth and mentorship. We believe in growing engineers through ownership and leadership opportunities. We also believe mentors help both sides of the equation.

  • Prior experience with GPUs and training/deployment of deep networks is a strong plus

Responsibilities
You will be responsible for building and deploying a scalable and real time detection service. Ensure easy deployment in a variety of customer environments. Key responsibilities include:

  • Working with the product team and other engineers to understand the business specifications and architect the product
  • Administer accounts and applications on AWS. Create scalable services that can receive thousands of calls in parallel, with input data
  • Develop APIs to facilitate product deployment and integration with key decision platforms
  • Integration with Spark cluster to process streaming data and execute algorithms in real time
  • Create basic reporting and visualization capabilities to output results of algorithms
  • Create and maintain code versions on GitHub
  • Work with customers to deploy and optimize services.

About EigenPatterns Inc.
We are an early stage startup based in the San Francisco Bay area. EigenPatterns develops collaborative anomaly detection and pattern recognition systems that blend machine learning and human insight, to deliver powerful real-time monitoring capabilities. We are a recipient of a prestigious National Science Foundation grant and are making energy safer for millions of people.

EigenPatterns is led by a skilled team with world-class expertise and decades of experience in statistical algorithm development, technology and software engineering, and an extensive publication record in leading journals. Built and deployed large-scale data and analytical services at companies like American Express and eBay/PayPal.

Software Developer Intern:


Do you like a challenge, are you a complex thinker who likes to solve problems? If so, then you might be the new Altairian we are searching for. At Altair, your curiosity matters. We pride ourselves on a business culture that enables open, creative thinking, and we deeply value our employees and their contributions towards our clients' success, as well as our own.

Job Summary:

As a Software Developer Intern, you will support the documentation teams by creating solutions to automate our processes and improve the user experience for external customers and internal stakeholders. We are transforming the way we write, publish, and deliver product documentation so that it is more modern and usable. We are seeking candidates who can adapt to changing priorities and maintain momentum on multiple projects, while bringing a dynamic, motivated, positive outlook to the team. Independence and initiative are critical, but diplomatic and collaborative efforts are also required in our diverse multi-cultural environment. As part of an engineering software company, you’ll be immersed in a high-tech culture and successful candidates will embrace new technologies and their innovative uses.


What You Will Do:

  • Update existing plugins for our publishing engine in the DITA Open Toolkit used to publish custom deliverables in webhelp and PDF formats. Implement using XML, XSLT, CSS, HTML, and JavaScript.
  • Implement automated weekly builds for the online help using Jenkins and our publishing engine. Manage the integration between Perforce, Jenkins, and the web server.
  • Work with the team to research and test prototypes for the next generation of help authoring tool software.
  • Improve speed and accuracy of local and online search engine in web-based help project.

What You Will Need:


  • Working towards a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Science, or a related field
  • Good programming and web development skills, proficiency in writing code and automation scripts
  • Self-motivated and dedicated to accomplishing objectives
  • Ability to work in a multicultural, distributed, and global environment and communicate with non-native English speakers
  • Advantage - working knowledge of:
  • CSS and JavaScript frameworks like AngularJS, Bootstrap, and jQuery
  • Python or similar programming languages

How You Will Be Successful:

  • Envision the Future
  • Communicate Honestly and Broadly
  • Seek Technology and Business “Firsts”
  • Embrace Diversity and Take Risks

What We Offer:

  • Competitive Salary
  • Training & Development - free training on Altair products

Why Work with Us:

Altair is a global technology company that provides software and cloud solutions in the areas of product development, high-performance computing (HPC) and artificial intelligence (AI). Altair enables organizations in nearly every industry to compete more effectively in a connected world, while creating a more sustainable future. With more than 3,000 engineers, scientists and creative thinkers in 25 countries, we help solve our customer’s toughest challenges and deliver unparalleled service, helping the innovators innovate, drive better decisions, and turn today’s problems into tomorrow’s opportunities.


Our vision is to transform customer decrision making with data analytics, simulation, and high-performance computing and artificial intelligence (AI).


For more than 30 years, we have been helping our customers integrate electronics and controls with mechanical design to expand product value, develop AI, simulation and data-driven digital twins to drive better decisions, and deliver advanced HPC and cloud solutions to support unlimited idea exploration. To learn more, please visit altair.com.

Ready to go? #ONLYFORWARD


At our core we are explorers; adventurers; pioneers. We are the brains behind some of the world’s most revolutionary innovations and are not only comfortable in new and uncharted waters, we dive in headfirst. We are the original trailblazers that make the impossible possible; discovering new solutions to our customer’s toughest challenges.

Altair is an equal opportunity employer. Our backgrounds are diverse, and every member of our global team is critical to our success. Altair's history demonstrates a belief that empowering each individual authentic voice reinforces a culture that thrives because of the uniqueness among our team.

Minimum Qual Requirements

Matriculation at an accredited college or graduate school. Employment is conditioned upon continuance as a student in a college or graduate school.

New America’s Resource Security Program seeks applicants for a summer research internship. The internship will be part of a policy exercise to test a conflict prediction model being developed by the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency (DARPA). There are three openings for five week paid internships (July 26th—August 27th, 2021).

About the Resource Security Program:

New America's Resource Security program looks at the intersection of security, prosperity, and natural resources, or "natural security." We seek to promote understanding and innovative public policy ideas, actions, and partnerships. For more information, please visit our website at https://www.newamerica.org/resource-security/

About the Project:

New America is collaborating with DARPA’s World Modelers program on this project. World Modelers aims to develop technology that integrates qualitative causal analyses with quantitative models and relevant data to provide a comprehensive understanding of complicated, dynamic national security questions. World Modelers analyses are intended to be timely enough to recommend specific actions that could avert crises, but also allow policymakers to test investments and ideas for efficacy. The first use case of World Modelers is food insecurity resulting from the interactions of multiple factors, including climate, water availability, soil viability, market instability, and physical security.

About the internship:

The research interns will participate in one week of training and preparation, including background research in relevant topic areas, followed by four weeks of user testing of the decision support tool. There may also be opportunities for contributing to blogs or reports on the project. This position is remote, but candidates should indicate whether they are flexible about possibly attending training in person, or working on site if that becomes possible.

Tasks and Responsibilities:

  • Attending all training sessions.
  • Conducting literature reviews and background research on key topics, to include peacebuilding, conflict studies, and food security.
  • Regular meetings with other testers, supervisors, and project sponsors.
  • Analytical testing of policy problem use case, with data collection.
  • Written reports or other materials on observations.

Required Qualifications:

  • Currently enrolled in or recently graduated from a Masters program in Computer Science, Statistical/Mathematical modeling, Public Policy, Security Studies, Diplomatic Studies, Conflict Studies, International Development, Agricultural Economics or a related field.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work in a team-oriented, diverse environment.
  • High level of attention to detail and accuracy of work.

Additional Skills (a plus, but not required):

  • Familiarity with modeling complex social, economic, and natural systems, such as drought, famine, and food security.
  • Familiarity with qualitative and quantitative causal analysis.
  • Interest in national security and environmental issues.
  • Ability to communicate well, in writing and verbally.

Application Process:

To apply, please submit a resume and one-page cover letter explaining your qualifications and interests. Applications will be reviewed and accepted on a rolling basis through May 14, 2021.

No phone calls, emails or letters please.

About Backblaze

Backblaze originated in a founder’s one-bedroom apartment where five people committed to helping people save their data. Backblaze provides backup and cloud storage that’s astonishingly easy to use and inexpensive. Our customers use our services so they can pursue dreams like curing cancer (genome mapping is data intensive), archiving the work of some of the greatest artists on the planet (learn more about how Austin City Limits uses B2), or simply sleeping well at night (anyone that’s spilled a cup of coffee on a laptop knows the relief that comes with complete, secure backups). We are entrusted with almost an exabyte of data from customers in more than 175 countries. We exited 2020 growing quickly and cash flow positive, and we’ve done all this with just $3M of funding.

We’ve managed to nurture a team oriented culture with amazingly low turnover. Our approach is guided by honesty, transparency, and a commitment to doing the right thing for our customers and coworkers. Our customers are happy, and so are our coworkers: In the most recent “Great Place to Work” survey, 99% of our team rated Backblaze as “a great place to work.” Check out what our employees are saying on Glassdoor!

But while there is a lot to celebrate in our past, there is almost as much opportunity ahead of us. We are seeking a Frontend Engineer Intern.

Backblaze is looking for a Frontend Engineer Intern to work alongside our frontend and marketing teams to make improvements to our company website. This opportunity will be both educational and practical. The ideal candidate will be personable, detail oriented, curious, a persistent problem solver, and inclined to ask questions when in doubt. If you’re interested in kickstarting your career in frontend engineering and getting a closer look into our company, we’d like to meet you.

What you’ll do:

  • Develop web pages using the traditional HTML/CSS/JavaScript web stack, jQuery and React.
  • Fine tune existing web pages as required by content editors.
  • Help debug UI/UX issues on existing web pages.
  • Collaborate with other frontend engineers, product managers, QA, and other stakeholders.
  • Participate in marketing and design meetings as required.

What the internship will provide you:

  • Opportunity to contribute to the website of a rapidly growing company.
  • Experience making changes within an established codebase.
  • Experience with the full software development lifecycle from specification design to release.
  • Exposure to a fast-paced, cross-functional team within a collaborative work environment.
  • Knowledge of what it’s like to work at Backblaze.

Requirements:

  • You have hands-on programming experience developing web pages using HTML/CSS/JavaScript, jQuery and React.
  • You are a student entering your Junior or Senior year in college.
  • You are able to fully commit to an 8 or 12-week(40 hours per week) internship.
  • You must be at least 18+ years of age at the start of the internship.
  • If the company returns to work at the San Mateo office, you must be ok with having dogs in the office.

Desired Qualifications:

  • Seeking an Associates and/or Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Computer Programming, or a related field.
  • Passion for attractive and functional UI/UX design.
  • Experience with the HTTP client-server communication model.
  • Familiarity with Git version control.

position: Summer 2021 Machine Learning Framework Software Development Intern (91262)
description:
What you do at AMD changes everything

At AMD, we push the boundaries of what is possible. We believe in changing the world for the better by driving innovation in high-performance computing, graphics, and visualization technologies – building blocks for gaming, immersive platforms, and the data center.

Developing great technology takes more than talent: it takes amazing people who understand collaboration, respect, and who will go the “extra mile” to achieve unthinkable results. It takes people who have the passion and desire to disrupt the status quo, push boundaries, deliver innovation, and change the world. If you have this type of passion, we invite you to take a look at the opportunities available to come join our team.


Machine Learning Framework Software Development Intern


THE ROLE:

Software development intern on teams building and optimizing Machine Learning system software for AMD GPU compute platforms. Work as part of an AMD development team and open source community to analyze, develop, test and deploy improvements to make AMD the best platform for machine learning applications.


THE PERSON:

Good skills in Python and C++ development in a Linux environment. Ability to work as part of a team, while also being able to work independently, define goals and scope and lead your own development effort.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Develop and optimize deep learning workloads on frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, ONNX-RT etc. on AMD processors
  • Work with open-source framework maintainers to understand their requirements – and have your code changes integrated upstream
  • Work in a distributed computing setting to optimize for both scale-up (multi-GPU) and scale-out (multi-node) systems
  • Optimize the entire deep learning pipeline
  • Apply your knowledge of software engineering best practices

PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:

  • Ability to work independently, define project goals and scope, and lead your own development effort.
  • Strong mathematical foundation in Tensors, Convolutions, Linear Algebra, Numerical Mathematics & Statistics
  • Good Python and C/C++ programming and software design skills, including debugging, performance analysis, and test design.
  • Knowledge of GPU computing (CUDA, HIP, OpenCL) and basic understanding of Deep Learning is a plus

ACADEMIC CREDENTIALS:

  • Masters or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related field.

Austin, TX

Santa Clara, CA
